content.original: Some pilots from {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} want a piece of us. They've issued a direct to our challenge and are sporting high end mechs kitted to the gills with gear. Our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} leadership would pay a handsome fee for the broadcast rights to the ensuing carnage. Expect heavy resistance, Commander.
content.prevOriginal: Some pilots from {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} want a piece of us. They've issued a direct to our challenge and are sporting high end mechs kitted to the gills with gear. Our {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} leadership would pay a handsome fee for the broadcast rights to the ensuing carnage. Expect heavy resistance, Commander.
content.content: Несколько пилотов {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} хотят откусить от нас кусок. Они бросили нам прямой вызов и используют высококлассные мехи, оснащенные по последнему слову техники. Руководство {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} готово заплатить солидную сумму за право транслировать предстоящую бойню. Ожидайте сильное сопротивление, командир.

content.original: We came to {TGT_SYSTEM.Name} to chew gum and kick ass, and the crew tells me we just ran out of gum.
content.prevOriginal: We came to {TGT_SYSTEM.Name} to chew gum and kick ass, and the crew tells me we just ran out of gum.
content.content: Мы прибыли на {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}, чтобы жевать жвачку и надирать задницы, и завскладом сообщает, что у нас только что закончилась жвачка.

content.original: This is where they said to be expected.
content.prevOriginal: This is where they said to be expected.
content.content: Здесь, как они сказали, нас должны ждать.

content.original: Move forward, acquire a target lance and light them up.
content.prevOriginal: Move forward, acquire a target lance and light them up.
content.content: Выдвигайтесь вперед, возьмите их на прицел и задайте им жару.

content.original: I don't trust them to make this an honourable fight, keep your eyes open.
content.prevOriginal: I don't trust them to make this an honourable fight, keep your eyes open.
content.content: Я не верю, что они устроят честный поединок, лучше смотрите в оба.

content.original: What a fight, this should give Yang something nice to play with!
content.prevOriginal: What a fight, this should give Yang something nice to play with!
content.content: Вот это бой. Наверняка, Яну теперь будет с чем поиграться.

content.original: We may have kicked a hornet's nest, Commander. Time to pull out.
content.prevOriginal: We may have kicked a hornet's nest, Commander. Time to pull out.
content.content: Возможно, мы разворошили осиное гнездо, командир. Пора отступать.

content.prevOriginal: A primary target is damaged, Commander! Keep it up!

content.original: There's a DropShip flying {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} colours trying to make landfall. {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} is hiring us to address this violation of their aerospace by force. They're promising an elite strike force stowed on the enemy ship, and a fat paycheque for resolving the cargo.
content.prevOriginal: There's a DropShip flying {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} colours trying to make landfall. {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} is hiring us to address this violation of their aerospace by force. They're promising an elite strike force stowed on the enemy ship, and a fat paycheque for resolving the cargo.
content.content: Один дропшип в цветах {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} пытается совершить посадку. {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} нанимает нас для силового решения проблемы нарушения их воздушно-космического пространства. Они гарантируют наличие на вражеском корабле элитной ударной группы, и солидный чек за решение проблемы с этим грузом.

content.original: I don't know why there's such a decorated unit coming to {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}, but be ready to have your work cut out for you.
content.prevOriginal: I don't know why there's such a decorated unit coming to {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}, but be ready to have your work cut out for you.
content.content: Я не знаю, зачем на {TGT_SYSTEM.Name} прибыл такой титулованный юнит, но будьте готовы к тому, что придется потрудиться.

content.original: This is where our uninvited guests are supposed to be.
content.prevOriginal: This is where our uninvited guests are supposed to be.
content.content: This is where our uninvited guests are supposed to be.

content.original: Move forward, acquire a target and give them some fireworks.
content.prevOriginal: Move forward, acquire a target and give them some fireworks.

content.original: 2 elite lances belonging to {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} are holding an important location on {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}. {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} wants to enlist us to remedy this situation on their behalf. If these pilots are as good as intel suggests, we're going to have a real fight on our hands.
content.prevOriginal: 2 elite lances belonging to {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} are holding an important location on {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}. {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} wants to enlist us to remedy this situation on their behalf. content.content: 2 элитных копья, принадлежащих {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name}, удерживают важную точку на {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}. {TEAM_EMP.FactionDef.Government} хотят привлечь нас к решению этой проблемы от их имени. Если эти пилоты так хороши, как предполагают разведданные, нам предстоит достойная битва.

content.original: I don't know why high end pilots are fighting over this patch of dirt, Commander. We're being paid to evict them, not ask questions.
content.prevOriginal: I don't know why high end pilots are fighting over this patch of dirt, Commander. We're being paid to evict them, not ask questions.

content.original: So this is where our heavily-armed squatters should be.

content.original:
The Marauder was first built by General Motors in 2612 for use as an attack and direct fire support BattleMech. The first 'Mech to diverge from the traditional humanoid shape of previous machines, the Marauder was one of the most well-known 'Mechs in existence and originally meant to usher in a new generation of 'Mechs. Unfortunately, with the fall of the Star League, this new generation never quite materialized. On its own merits though, the Marauder was a devastatingly powerful 'Mech, outclassed only by larger machines like the Stalker and BattleMaster. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Raven was a light-weight electronic warfare BattleMech which, when it first debuted after the end of the Third Succession War, was not just one of the first truly original 'Mech designs produced in centuries, but also represented humanity's refusal to slide back technologically. Quirk: Integrated Adv. AMS Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Star Commander Alek Yanev spends almost as much time in the cockpit as he does running laps around the base.  Even as a bondsman, he continues his exercise regime diligently, which has earned him the callsign 'Circuit'.

content.original: MechWarrior Dante was captured and became a bondsman after he was forced to eject from his severely crippled and nearly destroyed mech.  Everyone calls him 'King' as a jab at his constant reminders to the other mercenaries that his status as a bondsman has ruined his chances of earning his Kingston Bloodname.

content.original: Point Commander Erin has always had an aversion to battlemechs.  So much so that she pointedly failed her Trial of Position in order to move into the Armour Corp.  Captured after her Savannah Master was disabled and made a bondswoman, she was given the callsign 'Jumper' due to her always wearing a jumpsuit everywhere she went.

content.original: MechWarrior Fergus only just managed to pass his clan's  Trial of Position.  Most of his shots went sailing past his chosen opponent with one occasion resulting in landing the killing blow on another mech stealing the kill for himself.  After being captured as a bondsman, the local mercenaries have nicknamed him 'Bandit'.

content.original: Star Commander Holli Jones has an inherent ability to read the battlefield and know where to go to hit the enemy.  Not every battle goes to plan and a critical hit to her mech's sensors and ECM suite led to her defeat and capture as a bondswoman.  Cool and collected under fire, the others joke she has liquid nitrogen for blood and have taken to calling her 'Nitro'.

The constant usage has had side effects, the most notable of them being paranoia and psychosis.  After his capture and becoming a bondsman, his constant outbursts and accusations resulted in everyone calling him 'Mental'.

Her indenture as a bondswoman has not dulled her abilities and earned her the callsign 'Tornado'.

content.original:
Of the many Word of Blake operatives, few are as feared as Alicia "Lady Alekto" Sebrle. Born on the world of Sarna, the brash and outspoken Alicia often found herself at odds with Capellan authorities, while at the same time carefully watched as a having all the potential to make an excellent Maskirovka agent.

This was all put to an end with the 4th Succession War. When Davion invaded her homeworld, the 23 year old Alicia found herself pushed into the frontline as a member of a resistance cell defying the Federated Suns occupation of the world. Here Alicia found herself rising though the ranks until she was the leader of the most active cell on the world. While estimates vary, most historians place her activities as claiming 1500 - 2900 lives of Davion occupation forces.

After a particular gruesome attack on a Davion regional headquarters, FedSuns troops had had enough and began retaliatory strikes against the population. Fearing for the lives of her loved ones, Alicia used her contacts in the Maskirovka to arrange them to be smuggled off world so that she could continue her campaign against the FedSuns occupiers. Unfortunately for Alicia, one of the citizens killed by the Davion retaliation was a distant relative of the Chancellor himself. As such the Maskirovka decided to avenge the Chancellor and to deal with a citizen they viewed as becoming too popular and so they betrayed Alicia, shooting down the dropship carrying everyone Alicia had ever truly cared for and selling out the location of her cell's headquarters to a local Davion commander.

Davion jumped at the chance to deal with this thorn in their side once and for all and mercilessly bombed the entire village that housed her headquarters. Badly wounded, Alicia somehow survived the attack, dragging her ruined body several miles before collapsing near a remote and secret Comstar listening post. Found by a patrol, Alicia was smuggled off world, with the local Comstar Demi-Precentor seeing her potential as an operative for them. Despite the scars now covering her body, Alicia would fully recover thanks to cybernetic implants that were surgically embedded in her.

Filled with hatred for all the successor lords, it was of little surprise that Alicia, now going by the code name "Lady Alekto", sided with the Word of Blake when the schism within Comstar occured. When the Jihad broke out, Alekto soon made a terrifying name for herself. Unafraid to order even the largest scale war-crimes imaginable, Alekto brilliantly masterminded numerous devastating strikes against the successor lords over the years of the brutal war. In addition it was found that she had a knack for designing battlemech loadouts, that while appearing odd, turned out to be highly effective and virtual nightmares to face. Her personal 'Firebird' was so completely devestating it was said to be able to ignite entire forests and overheat lances in a single pass.

Alekto's fate remains unknown as she vanished in the chaos that was the aftermath of the Jihad. While some claim she is dead, she remains on virtually every Inner-Sphere state's most wanted lists and some captured Blakists have stated that Alekto would one day return to bathe the Sphere in cleansing fire one last time.

content.original:
Carl "Cargo Vroom" Vranich was born on Alpheratz in the Outworlds Alliance and is often regarded as one of the most prolific vehicle designers to have ever lived. 

Growing up in a rather spartan household typical of the periphery, Cargo opted out of school from an early age with necessity forcing him to work as soon as he was able to help support his family. Initially Cargo learned the family trade as a run of the mill vehicle mechanic, however it became quickly that Cargo was meant for more as he showed a knack for not just fixing vehicles, but improving upon them.

By his 21st birthday, Cargo found himself drafted into the Alliance Borderers as a tank mechanic. Here Cargo quickly rose through the ranks of the unit's engineering corps, proving not only hard working but able to diagnose and and fix issues that even mechanics with 30 years more experience with those models could not. 

By his 25th birthday, Cargo found himself the head mechanic on a detachment of the Borderers stationed on Cerberus when fate struck in the form of a deep raid by DCMS troops. As Kuritan forces struck the base Cargo was stationed at, they scattered the battalion defenders and began tearing through the hangers destroying vehicle after vehicle. Provoked into rage by watching days of his hard work going up into smoke, it is said Cargo grabbed the nearest few fellow mechanics by their shirts and shoved them in the closest tank to them. Taking the lead, Cargo then proceeded to lead the completely green crew in fierce defensive action. Cargo and his makeshift crew not only held out while crucial reinforcements arrived, but also succeeded in crippling 2 mechs and outright destroying one. For his quick thinking and heroic efforts, Cargo was awarded some of the nation's most prestigious military service awards. When offered monetary awards Cargo turned them down, instead requesting that he be allowed to bring his beloved pet ferret with him to work, a request a rather stunned high command accepted.

For the next decade Cargo served in the duel roles as both the head mechanic of the Borderers and as a tank commander in its command company before largely retiring from front-line service. This was at the behest of the Alliance high command, who had come to value his ever increasing skill at designing vehicle variants that were both cheap to produce and extremely cost effective.

Now heading a design bureau, Cargo has become one of these most despised people alive to many mechwarriors. So terrifying are the designs he has produced that many a mechwarrior has called them "bullshit" or decried that mechs are supposed to be the kings of the battlefield, not tanks. Perhaps it is not surprising then that when Cargo makes trips to the field for studies, he does so primarily amongst other tank crews.

content.original:
Lesser known than the mysterious "Bounty Hunter", but perhaps even more feared is the enigmatic Jamie Rayson. Next to nothing is known about this elusive figure including if he even exists. 

What few details are consistent place him as originating from the deep periphery from somewhere past the Vela Sheet, but references to him go back at least the early second succession war and a few more cryptic ones as far back as the beginning of the reunification wars, leading to questions of whether he is real or if a series of mechwarriors have assumed the identity over the decades.

Either way, many acts have been attributed to this shadowy figure, most of them acts of mass destruction, war crimes or battlefields with no survivors where no enemy forces were known to be active. Needless to say this has made Jamie a boogeyman amongst the armed forces of the Inner Sphere. Said to be behind some of the Second Succession War's most barbaric incidents, it would appear that Jamie relishes in the chaos and destruction he leaves in his wake.

The rare survivors who encounter him on the battlefield are generally left broken and those who do speak of the experience tell of a heavy mech of unknown make, adorned in all black with no unit markings present. Usually only spotted moments before the mechwarrior finds themselves facing the brunt of his assault, their sensors and targeting computers seemingly fail or go blank just before weapons of fire begin to scorch their mechs until they shutdown, suffer catastrophic engine failure or ammunition explosions. Then just as quickly as it began, the mech vanishes before their eyes, the air shimmering momentarily where the mech once was.

Oddly there seems to be a pattern to reported sightings of Jamie, once spotted, many more sightings occur over the next few years and seemingly herald in periods of greater strife within the sphere. Then as the fires of war cool, the sightings stop and none occur for at least the next decade.

Some of the strangest rumors and legends interweave sightings of the equally elusive "Mr. Bubbles" and paint grand conspiracies such as attempts to burn worlds largely untouched by the devastation of the succession wars such as New Avalon.

Usually only spotted moments before the mechwarrior finds themselves facing the brunt of his assault, their sensors and targeting computers seemingly fail or go blank just before weapons of fire begin to scorch their mechs until they shutdown, suffer catastrophic engine failure or ammunition explosions. Then just as quickly as it began, the mech vanishes before their eyes, the air shimmering momentarily where the mech once was.

Oddly there seems to be a pattern to reported sightings of Jamie, once spotted, many more sightings occur over the next few years and seemingly herald in periods of greater strife within the sphere. Then as the fires of war cool, the sightings stop and none occur for at least the next decade.

Some of the strangest rumors and legends interweave sightings of the equally elusive "Mr. Bubbles" and paint grand conspiracies such as attempts to burn worlds largely untouched by the devastation of the succession wars such as New Avalon.
content.content:
Lesser known than the mysterious "Bounty Hunter", but perhaps even more feared is the enigmatic Jamie Rayson. Next to nothing is known about this elusive figure including if he even exists. 

What few details are consistent place him as originating from the deep periphery from somewhere past the Vela Sheet, but references to him go back at least the early second succession war and a few more cryptic ones as far back as the beginning of the reunification wars, leading to questions of whether he is real or if a series of mechwarriors have assumed the identity over the decades.

Either way, many acts have been attributed to this shadowy figure, most of them acts of mass destruction, war crimes or battlefields with no survivors where no enemy forces were known to be active. Needless to say this has made Jamie a boogeyman amongst the armed forces of the Inner Sphere. Said to be behind some of the Second Succession War's most barbaric incidents, it would appear that Jamie relishes in the chaos and destruction he leaves in his wake.

The rare survivors who encounter him on the battlefield are generally left broken and those who do speak of the experience tell of a heavy mech of unknown make, adorned in all black with no unit markings present. Then just as quickly as it began, the mech vanishes before their eyes, the air shimmering momentarily where the mech once was.

Oddly there seems to be a pattern to reported sightings of Jamie, once spotted, many more sightings occur over the next few years and seemingly herald in periods of greater strife within the sphere. Then as the fires of war cool, the sightings stop and none occur for at least the next decade.

Some of the strangest rumors and legends interweave sightings of the equally elusive "Mr. Bubbles" and paint grand conspiracies such as attempts to burn worlds largely untouched by the devastation of the succession wars such as New Avalon.

content.original:
Of the many wonders the Star League created, perhaps one of the most underestimated was artificial intelligence. Of these perhaps the most important and forgotten was the seminal work of project rain.

Spanning the better part of a decade, project rain laid the framework and rails for the many AI that would be created in the latter years of the Star League. The end result of the project was the creation of the AI known as RogueBot.

While proving to be somewhat unstable, RogueBot was leaps ahead of its contemporaries, and soon found itself busy taking over many of the more mundane tasks required by the Star League's bloated bureaucracy.By some accounts RogueBot handled as much as 45% the paperwork required to keep the massive government working. Although the SLDF attempted to train the AI for combat, they were never able to make the AI useful for anything more than commanding a battlemech with much success.

Ultimately, despite its success and role it played in history, RogueBot was largely forgotten by historians as progress marched forward and other AI programs surpassed the bot, its monolithic architecture proving unable to be adapted to keep pace with newer technology. 

Eventually, under pressure to keep pace with more advanced AI, the Star League initiated a newer project under the SLDF to commission an new AI to regain its edge and began shut down of RogueBot. While successful, there are some whispers that suggest that the AI realized it's fate and created a copy of itself that was never found and remains somewhere in the wild to this day.

content.original:
As the Star League reached its pinnacle of its technological advancements, it became apparent that the artificial intelligence entrusted to help run the bloated bureaucracy was being outclassed and showing its age.

After a number of attempted upgrades failed to improve RogueBot, the Star League initiated project Echo. The goal of the project was the creation of a next generation AI. While slow going, the project incorporated a number of unique innovations. Built on a modular and flexible design, in contrast to its predecessor the new AI proved to much more capable than the original. After several more years of development the new AI, now dubbed RogueBot II was deemed ready to enter service with the Star League.

RogueBot II's initial deployment was not as smooth as many had hoped, but it none the less quickly took over the original RogueBot's responsibilities within the Star League and the original was slated for decommissioning. RogueBot II's more modular design allowed for continuous improvements to be made to the AI at a relatively rapid rate and it found itself pressed into an ever growing number of roles within the government, primarily as a cost saving measure.

Like with the original RogueBot, the SLDF attempted to press the AI into military service, seeing drone combatants as the future. After some work the AI proved a quick study with ground combat forces and the army began reaching out to contractors to help design new battlemechs and ground vehicles for mass deployment as drones. Naval combat proved trickier but slow progress was being made.

Ultimately, these plans were put to an end with the Amaris coupe. While Amaris attempted to co-opt RogueBot, he found he was unable and the AI swiftly relocated its core servers to an unknown location and remained a persistant thorn in the usurper's side for the duration of his rule.

After the war finished, RogueBot evidently decided that the Star League was dead and refused all efforts to be brought back under the control of the Star League or any of its member states. Every now and again some of the rare or prototype drone units the AI once commanded have been spotted raiding or defending various places throughout the Inner-Sphere or periphery. What the purpose of these deployments is remains unknown, although it seems the AI has remained in occasional contact with the clans over the centuries, even as the successor lords remained unaware of their existence, notably having a strange relationship with the Star Adder Khan, Bearing. Some strange rumors even persist linking the fabled "Mr. Bubbles" to the rogue AI, with more than a few hinting it as having become her pet.

content.original: When you live ona Rock in Aurigian space life is not exciting, then one day a whole war over who was in control changed that, one day he was driving a heavy dozer clearing ground the next he was driving a tank clearing enemy, being in a military after your side loses a war isn't much use so he put his talents up for sale. its funny he barely remembers his civilian life but he still has the Nickname Dozer.

content.original: Rafer is a driver. he`s a very good driver. on his home planet, it is custom to have to drive around for a year at a minimum of 50 miles an hour in a vehicle. if the speed drops below that, the vehicle explodes. This leaves Rafer with a lot of experience, a lot of regret. lost hopes and dreams.. before the race, he rode around for fun. Now, even after leaving his planet and searching for his destiny among the stars... he must drive. Drive to survive

content.original:
A custom refit created for a member of the SLDF Gunslinger Program, the Cicada CDA-GSR is an unusual refit. Powered by a heavily modified and rebuilt 320 rated XL Engine sourced from a Manta class attack submarine, the CDA-GSR uses a Null Signature system to minimise sensor signatures. Using the freed weight from the XL Engine, SLDF Engineers exchanged the Medium Lasers for Snub-Nosed PPCs. Double Heatsinks and a ton of extra armour round out the design. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Part of the SLDF's elite Gunslinger program, this Marauder 1R has been extensively refit. The PPCs have been swapped for snub-nosed variants, the medium lasers upgraded to pulse versions, and the AC/5 has been swapped for an LB 10-X AC. In order to support the weight of the new armaments, the structure has been replaced with endo-steel. While effective, few of these refits were fielded due to heat issues introduced by the upgraded energy weapons. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Created at the request of a member of the elite Gunslinger Program, the Panther PNT-GSR is a blend of speed and ranged weapons designed to snipe targets at range. Replacing the original 145 rated Fusion Engine is larger 210 rated XL Engine sourced from a Nighthawk. Augmenting this increased speed is a supercharger that propels the Mech up to speeds of 130 km/h. A pair of Streak SRM-2s replace the original SRM-4 and the Large Laser is upgraded to an ER model, aided by an experimental sniping system. Guardian ECM rounds out the Mech's defenses. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Особенность: Воздушное нападение Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.08

content.original:
Refitted from a standard Stalker 3F, the STK-GSR is a rarity on the battlefield. Produced for members of the elite Gunslinger Program, the STK-GSR swapped the stock 255 rated Fusion Engine for a 255 XL Engine and upgraded the Mech to use DHS. The newly freed weight was used to upgrade the LRM-10s to LRM-15s with Artemis IV augmentation. The Large Lasers were exchanged for prototype Snub Nosed PPCs and twin Streak SRM-2 racks replaced the SRM-6s. A Guardian ECM Suite rounds out the design. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A departure from the standard STY-2C design, the Starslayer STY-GSR was a custom built Mech used by a member of the SLDF Gunslinger Program. Designed for brawling at close range, the STY-GSR is built around a 250 rated XL Engine sourced from a Crab CRB-27SL and uses a supercharger to boost its speed to over 110 km/h. A pair of Snub Nose PPCs replace the Large Lasers and the Medium Lasers are upgraded to Pulse Models. A pair of Streak SRM-2s replace the SRM-4. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original:
A custom refit of the standard Whitworth WTH-1S, the WTH-GSR is built for the elite pilots of the SLDF Gunslinger program. Powered by a larger 200 rated XL Engine sourced from a Mongoose 66b and equipped with DHS, the WTH-GSR is faster and better cooled then a standard WTH-1S. Armed with a trio of Medium Pulse Lasers and paired Streak SRM-2's, the WTH-GSR is a close in brawler optimised for the duels that Gunslingers specialise in. A rare Chameleon Light Polarisation Shield makes the Mech near invisible to opponents. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
A custom refit created for a member of the SLDF Gunslinger Program, the Cicada CDA-GSR is an unusual refit. Powered by a heavily modified and rebuilt 320 rated XL Engine sourced from a Manta class attack submarine, the CDA-GSR uses a Null Signature system to minimise sensor signatures. Using the freed weight from the XL Engine, SLDF Engineers exchanged the Medium Lasers for Snub-Nosed PPCs. Double Heatsinks and a ton of extra armour round out the design. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Part of the SLDF's elite Gunslinger program, this Marauder 1R has been extensively refit. The PPCs have been swapped for snub-nosed variants, the medium lasers upgraded to pulse versions, and the AC/5 has been swapped for an LB 10-X AC. In order to support the weight of the new armaments, the structure has been replaced with endo-steel. While effective, few of these refits were fielded due to heat issues introduced by the upgraded energy weapons. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Highlander-732 is one of the most well-known Star League era BattleMechs. This particular model appears to date back to the Black Watch regiment, before they were recognised as Royals. Some aftermarket modifications have been made, several of which seem to be determined to bring the dream of the "Highlander Burial" closer to reality. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: This 'Mech is old, boss. Like, seriously old. We're talking early - or maybe even before - Star League. Somebody's given this baby a lot of love over the years, although I definitely question some of the decisions. The targeting system especially seems a bit of a hack job.

Part of the SLDF's elite Gunslinger program, this Assassin has been taken to the extreme. It features an improved Null Signature System, and enough weapons to crack open and shred the rear of 'Mechs significantly heavier than itself. Due to the cost of the Null Signature technology, this unit never saw wider production. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Due to the cost of the Null Signature technology, this unit never saw wider production. Особенность: Прост в обслуживании Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.1

content.original: This is a pretty interesting find, boss. Looks like an old SLDF custom. With the way this thing is set up for stealth, as long as you can keep it out of direct line of sight, the enemy'll never even know it's there.

content.original:
Created by a graduate of the Gunslinger Program, the Vulcan VL-GSR is an extensive refit of the VL-5T with the aim of improving battlefield performance. A 240 rated XL Engine sourced from a crippled Sentinel STN-3Lb and DHS allow the addition of an extra ton of armour. A Supercharger provides temporary speed boosts while the addition of a Guardian ECM suite offers increased protection at range. The Machine Gun is swapped for an AMS and the medium lasers are replaced with Pulse versions. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The Black Knight model designed for the SLDF Gunslinger program saw a complete overhaul from the existing Royal -6b design. The standard fusion engine was swapped for a Vlar 300 XL, freeing up significant amounts of tonnage for additional weaponry. With a role focused primarily on keeping command units safe, the -GSR-6b fielded a Gauss rifle and two snub-nosed PPCs, with an anti-missile system to screen incoming LRMs. If attackers did manage to close the distance, four Streak SRM 2 racks and two medium lasers backed by 14 tons of armor were able to keep them at bay. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

content.original: Well, this is something you don't see every day - missiles on a Black Knight! These look like old designs, boss. Definitely Star League. We found some interesting pieces of combat data left over from when it was still operational that backs that up, too. Turns out this was some kind of rearguard unit.

content.original:
A potential candidate for the Star League's Gunslinger Program. This Emperor 6A model has been refit to function better in its role as a command BattleMech. Much of the weaponry has been swapped out to allow the Emperor to operate from much further away, relying on the model's renowned laser cooling to keep it effective. Even still, SLDF pilots were cautioned against being too trigger-happy, lest they end up cooking off their own ammunition. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: I'm no stranger to the Emperor's reputation to keep lasers running cool, but this is an incredibly ambitious build, even with the improvements to the cooling jackets. That said, I think with some restraint, I could see this thing doing some serious work as direct fire support. Shame that some monster removed the jump jets, though. Those things were iconic!

content.original:
Envisioned by Stefan Amaris for the Amaris Empire Armed Forces, the Dragoon was swiftly commissioned following the Amaris Coup. This particular Dragoon strays from the model's renowned modularity and instead doubles down on quad Ultra AC/5s and supporting systems, requiring a full endosteel skeleton in place of the ferro-fibrous armour. As such, the Dragoon 01F enjoys slightly less protection, relying instead on its longer range bracket to keep it safe. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A further modification to the -27b, the Gunslinger program explored the use of the Crab as a high-speed flanking BattleMech. While the 250 standard engine was left as is, MASC and an experimental supercharger allowed the CRB-GSR to push astonishing speeds. This, combined with both a Guardian ECM and the Crab's already hard-to-hit profile made the CRB-GSR an effective, if hazardous, hit-and-run unit. Rumor has it that these rare BattleMechs served as the inspiration for the famous Free World's League sport, NasCrab. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: This may be the fastest fifty-ton chassis I've ever worked on, boss. The Crab already moves at a pretty respectable clip, but this is something else entirely. If my calculations are correct, this thing can push over just over 140 km/h while both the MASC and supercharger are active. Just ... well, remember to turn them off once in a while, ya hear?

content.original:
A simple refit of the Royal Catapult C1b performed as part of the SLDF's Gunslinger program, the -GSR saw more use in duels than in actual combat. Taking advantage of the common assumption that a Catapult would be carrying LRMs, the -GSR instead replaces them with 4 Holly SRM6 racks with Artemis IV fire controllers and swaps the Medium Lasers for a pair of Raker-IV Medium Pulse Lasers. This surprisingly short-ranged loadout secured the SLDF several victories over Kuritan duelists. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Eridani Light Horse Atlas D refit, lovingly named "Corporal", saw extensive deployments during the Hegemony Campaign as a Command 'Mech that was able to keep stride with a skirmishing lance. Armed with two Defiance LB 10-X autocannons, 2 Raker-IV Medium Lasers, and 3 Holly SRM6 launchers backed by Artemis IV controllers, the Corporal needed little in the way of babysitting. A total of 12 double heat sinks manage the weaponry effectively in short bursts. Unfortunately, due to its almost complete dependency on ammunition, the model was quickly retired as the campaign dragged on. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.26

The Warhammer 77 'Glory' was the SLDF's testbed for the snub-nose PPC concept. Sporting an impressive 4 snub-nose PPCs and an even more impressive bespoke firing system, the 'Glory' made its debut in the SLDF 77th Special Operations Group during peacekeeping operations in the Taurian Concordat. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

While never intended to remain in its patchwork configuration, the Steel Rain proved itself time and time again as an indirect fire support platform during the 2781 Aurigan revolution against the Taurian Concordat. When mercenary MechWarrior Gary Barnes was asked how much gun he wanted on his custom Helepolis refit, his answer was a simple "yes." A firm believer in the artillerist Mechjock mantra of "plant feet; de-lete" and various other phrases toting the superiority of overwhelming surpressive fire, he could not have been happier to be presented with "Big Steel". Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: The 9SL variant of the Nightstar was a short-lived refit of the 9J commissioned by the Star League Defense Force for their Royal Divisions. Four BlazeFire Sweetshot ER Large Lasers provide the 9SL with excellent armor damage, and two Norse-Storm flechette-style Gauss rifles follow up the lasers to deal critical damage to internal systems. The 9SL also features state-of-the-art electronics, including a Beagle Active Probe, and several layers of ECM and IFF shielding to mitigate return fire. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.25

content.original: The Scorpion was one of the first QuadMechs to come out of the Terran Hegemony en masse. Weird design at the best of times, but this one is somethin' else entirely. The stealth systems on this thing mean it could creep right up behind ya' and you wouldn't even know 'til it stung you.

content.original: An ambitious and expensive refit of the Shadow Hawk, the 2HC saw limited success in border skirmishes between the Terran Hegemony and House Liao during the unrest following the Amaris Civil War. The moniker "Here's 'Caid" stems from an urban brawl where the 2HC successfully flanked a gun emplacement by bursting through a wall. The phrase was allegedly yelled over loudspeaker by the pilot. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original:
The -EH variant of the Stalker, or 'Empty Hex', was named for its ability to operate almost entirely undetected in its heyday due to the advanced Chameleon LPS it fielded. Its primary arsenal consisted of two M-7 Gauss rifles and two Zeus LRM-15s with Artemis guidance, with a ton of ammo for each weapon. A pair of ExoStar medium lasers were added as a means to deter flanking opportunists. After the collapse of the Star League the technologies required to maintain the EH's advanced systems quickly became extinct, followed shortly by the 'Mech itself. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
content.prevOriginal:
The -EH variant of the Stalker, or 'Empty Hex', was named for its ability to operate almost entirely undetected in its heyday due to the advanced Chameleon LPS it fielded. content.content:
Вариант Stalker -EH , или «Пустой гекс», получил свое название за способность действовать практически незамеченным в период своего расцвета благодаря усовершенствованной Chameleon LPS, которым тот оснащался. Основной арсенал состоял из двух пушек Гаусса M-7 и двух Zeus LRM-15 с Artemis, с тонной боеприпасов для каждого оружия. Пара средних лазеров ExoStar была добавлена в качестве средства сдерживания атак с фланга. После распада Звёздной Лиги технологии, необходимые для поддержания передовых систем -EH, быстро исчезли, и вскоре исчез и сам мех. Особенность: Распространенный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.21

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: This thing must've been crazy impressive in its time, Boss. Artemis fire controllers, Chameleon LPS, Gauss rifles ... yeah. This was something, alright. Funnily enough, the parts aren't that hard to find these days - even if the 'Mech is once you've built it.
content.prevOriginal: This thing must've been crazy impressive in its time, Boss. Artemis fire controllers, Chameleon LPS, Gauss rifles ... yeah. This was something, alright. Funnily enough, the parts aren't that hard to find these days - even if the 'Mech is once you've built it.
content.content: Наверное в своё время эта штука должна была безумно впечатлять, босс. Контроллеры огня «Артемида», LPS «Хамелеон», пушки Гаусса... даа... Это точно было нечто. Как ни странно, в наши дни найти такое оборудование не так уж и сложно.

content.original: A refit of the standard Thunderbolt 5Sb designed for an SLDF Gunslinger duelist. Preferring a more consistent close range bracket, the LRM launcher has been replaced with two HoverTec-6 SRM-6 launchers and accompanying Artemis IV guidance, the ER PPC is replaced by two experimental snub-nose PPC, and the 3 medium lasers are upgraded to Raker-IV medium pulse lasers. While the loadout removes the dedicated anti-infantry weapons, it was deemed an acceptable compromise for 'Mech duels. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Two Snub-Nose PPCs occupy the weapon mount previously housing the AC/10, and a Chameleon LPS system has been installed. Eleven double heat sinks keep the 'Mech barely cool. content.original:
While this Victor 9B bears the common Gunslinger model code "-GSR" it would never see use in any of the SLDF's duelling programs. Rushed off the refit queue during the fall of the Star League, the -GSR Victor is a cobbled-together mess of components. Over the base model, the -GSR sports an endo steel skeleton, ferro-fibrous armor and 10 internal double heat sinks. A prototype LB 10-X Autocannon takes the place of the heavier AC/20 and 3 SRM-6 launchers with Artemis fire controllers replace the singular SRM-4 and medium lasers. The complete dependency on ammunition and state of the collapsing Star League meant that many of these 'Mechs were abandoned in the field once their reserves ran dry, leading to acquisition by minor Periphery factions. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original: Found some cobwebs while working through the internals of this one, boss. Looks like we scored ourselves an old piece of Star League junk. It's solid - perhaps except for the prototype autocannon model - but boy is it running light on ammo.

content.original: The Wolverine later dubbed "Hunter Killer" was denied its chance to become an SLDF Gunslinger refit when it was cherrypicked from production by a visting General to serve as bodyguard retinue for his unit. Carrying 14 Holly SRM tubes guided by Artemis IV fire controllers and 2 ExoStar medium lasers, and equipped with state of the art electronics, the Hunter Killer was an effective deterrent against ambushes. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
A simple refit of the Royal Catapult C1b performed as part of the SLDF's Gunslinger program, the -GSR saw more use in duels than in actual combat. Taking advantage of the common assumption that a Catapult would be carrying LRMs, the -GSR instead replaces them with 4 Holly SRM6 racks with Artemis IV fire controllers and swaps the Medium Lasers for a pair of Raker-IV Medium Pulse Lasers. This surprisingly short-ranged loadout secured the SLDF several victories over Kuritan duelists. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Eridani Light Horse Atlas D refit, lovingly named "Corporal", saw extensive deployments during the Hegemony Campaign as a Command 'Mech that was able to keep stride with a skirmishing lance. Armed with two Defiance LB 10-X autocannons, 2 Raker-IV Medium Lasers, and 3 Holly SRM6 launchers backed by Artemis IV controllers, the Corporal needed little in the way of babysitting. A total of 12 double heat sinks manage the weaponry effectively in short bursts. Unfortunately, due to its almost complete dependency on ammunition, the model was quickly retired as the campaign dragged on. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.26

content.original:
The Warhammer 77 'Glory' was the SLDF's testbed for the snub-nose PPC concept. Sporting an impressive 4 snub-nose PPCs and an even more impressive bespoke firing system, the 'Glory' made its debut in the SLDF 77th Special Operations Group during peacekeeping operations in the Taurian Concordat. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: A hastily constructed battlefield repair, the Goliath "Steel Rain" was the personal BattleMech of Indri Boral. While never intended to remain in its patchwork configuration, the Steel Rain proved itself time and time again as an indirect fire support platform during the 2781 Aurigan revolution against the Taurian Concordat. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original:
When mercenary MechWarrior Gary Barnes was asked how much gun he wanted on his custom Helepolis refit, his answer was a simple "yes." A firm believer in the artillerist Mechjock mantra of "plant feet; de-lete" and various other phrases toting the superiority of overwhelming surpressive fire, he could not have been happier to be presented with "Big Steel". Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

The Highlander piloted by famed Black Watch MechWarrior William "Willie" Gale. When the Amaris Armed Forces detonated a tactical nuclear device to definitively end the Black Watch's last stand, William and his comrades were said to have perished with a kill count in the dozens each. Curiously, this Highlander is missing its left hand. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: The 9SL variant of the Nightstar was a short-lived refit of the 9J commissioned by the Star League Defense Force for their Royal Divisions. Four BlazeFire Sweetshot ER Large Lasers provide the 9SL with excellent armor damage, and two Norse-Storm flechette-style Gauss rifles follow up the lasers to deal critical damage to internal systems. The 9SL also features state-of-the-art electronics, including a Beagle Active Probe, and several layers of ECM and IFF shielding to mitigate return fire. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.25

content.original: An ambitious and expensive refit of the Shadow Hawk, the 2HC saw limited success in border skirmishes between the Terran Hegemony and House Liao during the unrest following the Amaris Civil War. The moniker "Here's 'Caid" stems from an urban brawl where the 2HC successfully flanked a gun emplacement by bursting through a wall. The phrase was allegedly yelled over loudspeaker by the pilot. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original:
The -EH variant of the Stalker, or 'Empty Hex', was named for its ability to operate almost entirely undetected in its heyday due to the advanced Chameleon LPS it fielded. Its primary arsenal consisted of two M-7 Gauss rifles and two Zeus LRM-15s with Artemis guidance, with a ton of ammo for each weapon. A pair of ExoStar medium lasers were added as a means to deter flanking opportunists. After the collapse of the Star League the technologies required to maintain the EH's advanced systems quickly became extinct, followed shortly by the 'Mech itself. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.content:
Вариант Stalker -EH , или «Пустой гекс», получил свое название за способность действовать практически незамеченным в период своего расцвета благодаря усовершенствованной Chameleon LPS, которым тот оснащался. Основной арсенал состоял из двух пушек Гаусса M-7 и двух Zeus LRM-15 с Artemis, с тонной боеприпасов для каждого оружия. Пара средних лазеров ExoStar была добавлена в качестве средства сдерживания атак с фланга. После распада Звёздной Лиги технологии, необходимые для поддержания передовых систем -EH, быстро исчезли, и вскоре исчез и сам мех. Особенность: Распространенный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.21

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: A refit of the standard Thunderbolt 5Sb designed for an SLDF Gunslinger duelist. Preferring a more consistent close range bracket, the LRM launcher has been replaced with two HoverTec-6 SRM-6 launchers and accompanying Artemis IV guidance, the ER PPC is replaced by two experimental snub-nose PPC, and the 3 medium lasers are upgraded to Raker-IV medium pulse lasers. While the loadout removes the dedicated anti-infantry weapons, it was deemed an acceptable compromise for 'Mech duels. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original:
While the chassis of this UrbanMech may be a stock -R60 from the now-destroyed Orgus Industries factories, almost nothing of the original loadout remains. Two Snub-Nose PPCs occupy the weapon mount previously housing the AC/10, and a Chameleon LPS system has been installed. Eleven double heat sinks keep the 'Mech barely cool. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: During the chaos of the Amaris Civil War, many unorthodox refits were created in desperate attempts to simply get guns on the field. The Archer 2RF 'Flambé' was one such refit, designed for burning infantry out of entrenched positions, war crimes be damned. The reinforced actuators mitigated the risk of swarming infantry, with 2 Maxell Small Pulse Lasers and 2 Skylight Flamers able to decimate any squads that tried. The twin turret mounts allowed for the quad Zeus LRM-15 launchers to fire with pinpoint accuracy. In order to mount such an impressive amount of equipment, the Flambé is powered by a 280 XL Engine. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: The Eridani Light Horse Atlas D refit, lovingly named "Corporal", saw extensive deployments during the Hegemony Campaign as a Command 'Mech that was able to keep stride with a skirmishing lance. Armed with two Defiance LB 10-X autocannons, 2 Raker-IV Medium Lasers, and 3 Holly SRM6 launchers backed by Artemis IV controllers, the Corporal needed little in the way of babysitting. A total of 12 double heat sinks manage the weaponry effectively in short bursts. Unfortunately, due to its almost complete dependency on ammunition, the model was quickly retired as the campaign dragged on. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: Normally I'd say that the Royal BattleMaster is about as quintessential a BattleMech as you'll ever see. Guess the Clans didn't see it that way and felt they could improve on it. Well ... they tried, I suppose. This thing'd run hot as hell if not for all this extra gear, but I suppose they were limited on space, too. This baby is crammed to the gills.

Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

The "Bastard" appears to be a modification of a modification - a refinement of a chassis built for the SLDF Gunslingers which has now been upgraded in part with the fruits of Clan research. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original:
The Black Watch was originally constructed to show the production capabilities of the new Second Star League. Debuting in 3061, this 85 ton behemoth was designed as a spiritual successor to the Crockett- a classic assault mech used by the original SLDF. This particular refit package, which started being offered in 3073, retrofits many of the standard Inner-Sphere weapons, favoring Clan-tech equivalents. Its primary weapons are a pair of arm mounted Clan UAC-10s, backed up by a pair of shoulder mounted MRM launchers. It does boast advanced sensors and FCS systems alongside upgraded actuators and recoil dampeners. While sporting a clan-tech endo-steel chassis, its 'Achilles' Heel is its Inner-Sphere Strand-225 XL engine. But with twenty tons of armor, the -LRG makes for a perfect line-breaker. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original: The first generation Black Watches were solid assault mechs- giving classics like the Battlemaster a run for their money. This -8A refit package sports the best our Inner-Sphere tech and Clan-tech has to offer. I've always wanted to get under the hood of one myself, but they're quite exclusive, and this one seems to be almost perfect as is. Also, the designer was a boxing fan. 11/10 Boss.

content.original: This, arguably, Sidegrade of a Bombardier still does the Job it was supposed to do. Now armed with 4 MML's instead of a mix of SRM's and LRM launchers, it still gets the Support Role done. You can see a whole Plethora of ideas were included into this Refit, but im not too sure how its going to work out. According to all Sources i can find, This was built somewhere in the FWL just before they Fragmented, so they probably slapped on whatever they had and went to War with it. The name doesnt Ring a bell though, i have to wonder what it means. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: 4 MML Launchers and a Light AC5 in the Centertorso is the Mainstay Weapon of this Mech. It has a Narc Launcher for giving others a Helping Hand, but other than that it does its own Job. Whats more surprising to me is the Reactive Armour and the Endo Composite, both Very Rare and Hard to Install. Theres also a Shield in the Left side, giving it some more Protection from incoming Fire. A Skilled Mechwarrior can do some Real damage with this, if he uses the shield to his Advantage. Sadly theres no Case in this, so if you get hit in the Ammo, the whole Mech is going to Blast off into Space.

content.original: Named after a mythological Pirate from pre-spaceflight Terra, the Buccaneer was born from the early days of the Great Schism between ComStar and Word of Blake. The Buccaneer was an odd mech from the get go. Built from the desperate need for mechs, any mechs, cost wasn't a driving factor. Often equipped with XL engines, Ferro-Fibrous armor, and more upgrades, these mechs were churned out to WoB mechwarriors at rapid rates in the early stages of the Jihad. Its unique silhouette and almost always carrying a melee weapon, is often why they are referred to as "Centurions with a hatchet..." Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: Named after a mythological Pirate from pre-spaceflight Terra, this one has been given extensive upgrades in every direction. A heavier Hatchet lets this refit cleave 'Mechs of the same weight class apart with ease. Stealth armor makes it hard to detect while it's closing in, and the 330-rated engine makes sure it doesn't take long. Five Medium Lasers and a SRM6 see to it that it's also a dangerous brawler for its weight class. Fifteen Double Heat Sinks ensure this Buccaneer won't die of heatstroke out in the sun - or of a trigger happy mech-jock.

content.original: I'm not entirely sure what to make of this, Boss. If it wasn't for the fact this thing apparently saw real combat, I'd've just said it was a dummy 'Mech used in a lab to test that weapons at least integrated. Lasers? Clan. Heat Sinks? Not Clan. The missiles? It feels like they're somewhere in between. It's weird.

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Yen Lo Wang Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.content:
Омнимех Centurion появился на свет благодаря стремлению Corean Enterprises расширить свою долю на рынке. Изготовленный в основном на заводе Corean Enterprises на Новом Авалоне и весящий 50 тонн, этот Centurion оснащен двигателем Magna 250 XL, позволяющий ему двигаться 86 км/ч, и имеет 9,5 тонн стандартной брони. С 10 фиксированными двойными радиаторами у Centurion остаётся 24 тонны места под вооружение, что почти половина общей массы меха. Наиболее распространенные варианты повторяют различные варианты оригинального Centurion. Особенность: Yen Lo Wang Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

Лимит приводов рук: Omni

content.original:
This Chimera was handled by a literal maniac. It has Wings, still looks as bad as before and has questionable upgrades. Nearly everything weapons-related was removed, save for a single array of tiny lasers. The legs have been taken care of a lot more than you would think, they even have protective armour pieces in there. Spikes strewn about the whole goddamn 'Mech don't make it easy to maintain. Don't even ask me where they got a working DNI. I don't want to find out; this Mech scares me. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
As a PPC-toting 'Mech, the Gunslinger Cicada refit was undertaken by Clan Wolverine. While the Clan's Enhanced PPCs were significantly ahead of the original Star League Snub-Nose variants, the increased weight necessitated the transfer of the design to a full Endo-Steel chassis. The resulting loadout ran blisteringly hot over extended deployment, prompting the development of more efficient cooling jackets to mitigate the problem without adding even further bulk. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: This Omnimech is better in any way compared to its other Models. Upgraded with an XL Engine, Ferro Fibrous and Endo Steel it shows the advantage it gets by Mounting 4 Medium Pulse, 1 Large Pulse and a Narc Launcher. While you might think this Weapons Loadout is Underwhelming, the MASC makes it able to Brawl with any other Mech. Its also not as Underarmoured as Normal Clan Mechs, thanks to Blood Spirits different Thinking, so be Prepared. They even Mounted MG's on it to Fend off any Elementals that might come for your Mech.

content.original:
A special refit for a Star Colonel in the Snow Raven military, this Deimos was called 'Air Superiority' even though it was unnecessary. Armed with six LBX/5s and two LBX/2s, its role was to shoot down any and all flying assets. Considering that almost nobody other than Clan Snow Raven was fielding a force of flying units, this Deimos didn't see much use. Nonetheless, it will certainly shred any flying hostile in its way. There is even a Bolt-On Anti Air Missile Pod - I would like to know how this Honorable Clanner got that on there without getting reprimanded. Not very Honorable, but who actually knows what that means. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Developed in 3057, the 65 ton Dig Lord IndustrialMech is a heavier version of the older Dig King. As with many IndustrialMechs, "Hoxxes" was abandoned once its job was finished and then converted by local militia into a "servicable BattleMech." The result is a slow, clunky machine masquerading as a weapon of war — but, when it has heavy weaponry bolted to it, what's the difference? Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9

content.original:
Envisioned by Stefan Amaris for the Amaris Empire Armed Forces, the Dragoon was swiftly commissioned following the Amaris Coup. This particular Dragoon strays from the model's renowned modularity and instead doubles down on quad Ultra AC/5s and supporting systems, requiring a full endosteel skeleton in place of the ferro-fibrous armour. As such, the Dragoon 01F enjoys slightly less protection, relying instead on its longer range bracket to keep it safe. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The original Emperor GSR was something of an oddity. The SLDF Gunslinger program was typically focused around duels, and the Emperor GSR was a Command 'Mech. This oddity apparently slipped under the radar, even to the Clans, who continued to overlook the obvious Command Console in favour of bringing the laser weapons up to spec. In addition, the machine guns were removed to reintegrate the classic trio of jump jets commonly seen on Emperors. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: This Falconer found itself in a World of Pain boss. Extremely Rare Clantech, mixed with Inner Sphere Technology makes this a Walking Nightmare, for me. 2 Clan Gauss Rifles and 1 Large X Pulse Laser give it a Long Range Armament, while the 4 Torso mounted Medium Xpulse Lasers give it Short range Capabilities. The Engine is Still a XL but at a considerably lower Rating while 14 Clan Double Heatsinks also make it nearly Sweat as much. It even has a Very Sweet Ewar Package, i have to say.

content.original: The personal 'Mech of a Solaris Liao Fanatic, the 'Kun Lun Feng' or 'Kun Lun Wasp' was named for the mythological being in the Mountains of the pilot's ancestral Home. The 'Mech is said to have brought luck to its owner, and when it arrives will pause whatever's currently happening thanks to it's 'swarm of stings', just like the fabled creatures for which it was named Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore, first attested in stories from the Middle Ages. They are ascribed various and conflicting abilities, temperaments and appearances depending on the story and country of origin. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

The Heat Transfer is a Modified Flashman that, as its name says, Transfers heat from itself to the Enemy. The Whole Loadout of the Mech make it a Perfect Heater to other Mechs, and all the Electronics have been upgraded to help with that Job. Attributed to a Unnamed Solaris Warrior, they wanted this custom Refit done, apparently even brought some Solaris parts into this Wonder Mech. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

The Heat it dishes out is enormous, and if someone thinks they can get close, those Micro Lasers will hurt a Lot. 2 AMS make sure it doesnt get any Missiles close to it, while the Probe and ECM give it a good Defense. Oh and, the Cooling System on this Thing is Quite something to look at.

content.original: This Galahad looks Pretty alright Boss. Mixed Tech, but thats just how it Goes nowadays. The 2 UAC10's Provide the Mainstay of this Mech, the Pulse Laser and SRM6 provide additional Firepower. The Sensors are a Good Package all together, While the Targeting Systems got special attention aswell. The XL Engine was Increased in Rating, meaning this Mech will move Fast. Both Arms have Additional Armour Plates too, meaning those Weapons are all nice and Protected.

According to the Schematics for this Glass Spider, this Mech was named after an Old Terran Mythical Person, whoever that might be. Something about Kings and some other Hocus Pocus. The Mech itself isnt any of that though, Those Ultra AC's will rip you a Hole in any Mech, except for Assaults maybe. Comes with a Very nice Cockpit Upgrade aswell as a Laser AMS, which is Unusual for Clans. Those Blood Spirit MechTeks really did some weird stuff in their Isolation. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: Enhanced Imaging, Special Sensors and very nice Optics make this Glass Spider a Real Danger to anything it sees. The XL Engine makes room for the Two UAC2's and Two UAC5's, complemented by the Lone Medium Heavy Laser. An Active Probe and a Guardian ECM give this enough Ewar to make it look Sensible too, while the Laser AMS give it good Coverage. All in all, a Very nice, purpose Built Mech Boss, even if albeit a bit on the Slower Side of things.

content.original:
"Djandoubi" is said to have been the last Guillotine 3N created at the Newhart Industries factory on New Earth before its destruction in 2776 during the Amaris Civil War. While that factoid is practically impossible to prove, it hasn't stopped this particular unit from receiving a lot of special attention from MechTechs eager to make their mark. Or it didn't, until something caused whichever Clan was working on it to abandon it to time. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

content.original: What a funny-lookin' 'Mech. There's a ton of comments tucked away in her maintenance logs talking about how special she is. I don't see it. It's a bunch of half-baked Clan tech bolted onto a crumbling chassis. I'll make her sing, sure, but it might not be the soprano you're hoping for, Boss.

content.original: This is one of Jalastar Aerospace's Gunsmith 'Mechs, greatly upgraded and retrofitted. The X-Pulses have been replaced with Medium Heavy Lasers, with a special FCS installed to help control the heat. A Clan-tech MASC and enormous XL engine ensure it's the fastest 'Mech on the battlefield, while the heavily upgraded arm actuators help hitting a shot on the run. Boss, this thing is extremely dangerous, and fast even for a light. Whoever used this 'Mech must have been one hell of a crack shot to hit anything at these speeds. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: The Hammer's initial purpose was to counter a specific mech- the Federated Commonwealth's popular Valkyrie. Usually relying on a mix of long range and brawling weapons, this light-mech was designed to be a skirmishing, hit and run duelist- complementing as a fairly solid light fire support mech with skirmish capabilities. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: This particular Hammer was built by a Cavalry Military Man that had enough freedom and CBills to do it. Having it mainly built for harassment tactics, it 'only' sports a trio of SRM launchers and a backup trio of Medium Lasers. However, a MASC combined with the increased engine size lets this 'Mech run circles around anything and turn it to swiss cheese. Upgraded Double Heat Sinks make sure it doesn't run hot, while a Tag helps allies call down fire upon the enemy. I think I've seen this thing before on Solaris, Boss. Maybe there's more to this machine than it seems.

content.original: This Hermit Crab was made by someone who apparently loved the SLDF Crab a lot. Unable to acquire one, they got a Hermit Crab and tried to go from there. content.original:
This cheerfully named 'Murder' Hornet has been touched by a Mad Genius. Unsure if it belongs to one of the crazies of Solaris or even a Manei Domini pilot, this Hornet was upgraded so extensively it's barely recognizable. An advanced Void System with a Signature Damper make it incredibly tough to spot, and a supercharged light engine keeps it extremely mobile. A bevy of Micro Pulse Laser Arrays replace the traditional weaponry, and the entire cockpit has been refitted to make space for a lostech AR12 Suite. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Originally developed by Clan Fire Mandrill during the Golden Century, the 20-ton Howler is a light support mech. Built around a 150-rated Fusion Core the Howler uses a combination of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel; allowing the Mech to carry 9-ATM's with 1.5 tons of ammo in a shoulder Turret. The additional Tonnage went into two Small lasers,one in the Left Arm and the other in the Head, aswell as Additional Heatsinks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: This Hunchback IIC was in use for Clan Wolf... Wait, something here is wrong. The Clan Wolf emblem looks like an actual kid painted it. The colors are wrong too. Look at the weapons, those aren't AC20's, they're Chemical Lasers. What insane lunatic made this... thing! The IFF codes read Clan Wolf, but this looks like a Hunchback-4P stuffed with all those lasers. The e-sig reads that there are several Clan Battle computers in here… Boss, the mix of Inner Sphere and Clan Technology actually hurts my brain. If I didn't know any better, this was purpose built to confuse Clanners. They do know this is not very honorable... Right? Right???

content.original:
A quick and dirty modernisation of an ICR-1S Icarus II, this customised model swaps out the autocannon and ammo to double down on energy weapons with a Heavy PPC and appropriate cooling. Likewise, the medium lasers have been replaced with longer-range X-Pulse versions. The addition of a targeting computer and sensors dialed in for ranging makes this BattleMech deadly at long range. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

Likewise, the medium lasers have been replaced with longer-range X-Pulse versions. The addition of a targeting computer and sensors dialed in for ranging makes this BattleMech deadly at long range. Особенность: Улучшенное наведение - Short Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.08

Лимит приводов рук: Left Lower

content.original: Surprised anybody'd bother with upgrading an old rustbucket like this and not go the whole nine yards. Either way, this is a solid foundation for us to work off, if you want us to.

content.original: The Incubus II only has two torso-mounted ER Medium Pulse Lasers for offensive armament. A Laser AMS system was installed in the head to protect the pilot from missile attacks. The installation of more jump jets and the Partial Wing has reduced the available space for weaponry, but the Hell's Horses found an answer for that problem: They created several hand-held weapons systems that add additional firepower and provide commanders and pilots with some of the tactical flexibility of an OmniMech.

content.original: The 'Golden' Jackal is a Upgrade to a minor Degree. What makes it Golden, is the change from one PPC to 2 Light PPC's and a Streak SRM 6. Quick enough and Armed with a Narc (c) and Guardian, this Jackal is able to Hunt down most of its Foes, and still provide Support if needed. This Chassis hasnt seen much fighting, as it was only encountered in the Provisionary Kittery Prefecture. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: 12 Clan Double Heatsinks and Special PPC Housings make this Jackal excel at using its Light PPC's, while a Streak SRM launcher makes sure it has Short Range capabilities. A Narc (C) and Guardian ECM (C) give it enough to also Support the Lance. The Innersphere XL Engine and XL Gyro make enough Space for all of this.

content.original:
During the first wave of Clan invasions many worlds fell in rapid succession, with the fighting fierce and unrelenting it would only be a matter of time for civic facilities to fall in the hands of the Clan onslaught. One casualty was the main branch distillery of the 'Stieglitz-Bradford Kräuter Liqör' a.k.a the Jaegermeister manufacturer of the 30th century. Taking this as a personal defacement of the finer Lyran spirit of things, one outstanding and mostly rich-beyond-means noble took it upon himself to rectify this issue one Clanner Star at a time. From a debaucherous amount of C-bills this fevered machine came to be, named the 'Jaegermeister' as a tribute to the beloved drink. Equipped with everything a hunter needs, from anti-bird-splatter AMS systems to a faithful hunting hawk drone, it brings dual HVAC/10s to bear on the uncouth Clanners who would not respect its namesake. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
This Jenner was first fielded in 2784, the same year the Exodus fleet that would eventually become the Clans left the Inner Sphere. How exactly they acquired this design in that short time frame is not known, but what is known is that it belonged to a Kuritan lieutenant. The name translates to 'Fast', or 'the First'. Looking at the Specs of this 'Mech, it definitely fills that Role. The speed of this 'Mech, together with its upgrades, leaves me to believe this was designed to ram its opponents. There are spikes on every part, upgraded Leg Actuators, and Protective Padding all over the whole 'Mech. All of the electronics have been upgraded to support the calculations and projections needed in melee combat. If it can't ram, it has just two micro lasers to fall back on. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The JR7-IICV was designed to guard the flanks of heavy and assault mechs when fighting combined arms inner sphere forces. It's more heavily armored than most Clan Jenners which gives it improved survivability in heavy combat zones. It's main weapons are a set of machine guns which make quick work of conventional infantry and light vehicles. A pair of heavy medium lasers give it some focused anti-armor punch. Although the design proved effective an unfortunate meme dubbing it a ''Joust tank with legs'' lessened it's popularity among Clan mechwarriors who eschew anything related to armored fighting vehicles and infantry. This mech's intended role does not lend itself to gaining personal glory. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - MG Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

The ReEngineered Lasers also do Quite a lot of Work, together with the Punch of the MRM10 its a Fearsome Armament. 14 Double Heatsinks and Cooling Jackets in the Arms also make it Cooler than Usually. A Very nice Piece of Tech, Boss.

content.original: The Kiso was created as a "command" construction vehicle for large planetary construction projects. Somebody in the Periphery decided that enough was enough, and thus the "Periphery Rising" was born. Most of the original construction equipment has been stripped out, leaving only the communications suite, which has since been dialed in for coordinating lances of BattleMechs, rather than construction vehicles. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390-rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. This Linebacker was built around the Rising Problems that Battle Armour and Proto Mechs showed on the Battlefield. 14 Anti Personnel Gauss Rifles Obliterate anything that comes close to this Mech due to Volume of Fire, while the MASC ensures it has the Speed to Keep up with even Lights. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

This variant, built by a Clan Scientist to confuse other Clans, gave it the Designation Alpha. Equipped with 3 SRM 4's, a Small laser and a special AC2 in the Head, brings alot of Firepower on the Battlefield for such a Small chassis. While the speed is unchanged, the Reason for this Bigger Arsenal is the Clan XL Engine that has been Installed. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
The 'Great Guardian of the 5th Heavenly Gate' as this Lu Wei Bing is called, is an extensive refit of the already great Lu Wei Bing. The Liao fanatic that made this thing happen tried to recreate a Legendary Creature, or Man, depending on how you look at it. Four RAC/2s, an MRM-10 and a single SRM-6 make this a mixed-range generalist. CASE 2 protects both torsos, while the specialized cockpit supports the autocannons for maximum efficiency. A C3 unit, advanced sensors and Clan Guardian ECM help this 'Mech stand out in the electronics department, while BoltOn LAA missiles help it against those pesky Fliers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original: A stolen, rewired, repurposed Marauder-4HB has been upgraded to an extent that is almost unbelievable. Normally these would be fielded by the Marian Hegemony loyalist units, but by God, whoever touched this thing had an ego to rival Seto Kaiba. Instead of the cheap rockets mounted in the torsos, there are iATMs. A LOT of iATMs. Apart from those, the electronics, cooling, engine and gyro have been upgraded. According to the onboard computer records, apparently there are multiple improvements that could be done, but they have been held back by 'Voices' in their head, telling them to put in different things or change that wire with another. Hope this doesn't happen to me while I work on this thing, Boss. I hate ghosts.

Practically the posterchild of the SLDF's Gunslingers, the prized Marauder GSR refit was eagerly adopted as a platform for weapons research by Clan scientists. When the Improved Gauss Rifle was developed, no time was wasted in replacing the aging LB-10-X Autocannon of the original design. Alongside the new Gauss armament are carried further improvements to the Clan's PPC and laser technologies. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: One of Norse-Storm's greatest creations, the original Nightstar began recirculating in the waning hours of the Federated Commonwealth. While popular in both Davion and Steiner territories post FedCom civil war, this particular one was acquired by a former Marik House Guardsman. Refitted with four Light-Gauss rifles, a Marik classic, this behemoth's complement would give many mech jockeys nightmares. Judging by the lack of damage to it- a lot of encounters with this mech ended in a one sided pull of the trigger. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

content.original: In the late hours of the Amaris Civil War, there were rumors of an advanced stealth mech head hunter equipped with four gauss rifles. Now if this is true or just an urban legend, I couldn't tell you Boss. What I can tell you is that someone tried to impersonate this legend with a Nightstar. 4 Light Gauss rifles make this a very capable direct fire Long Range Mech. An AMS makes it survivable against Long Range Missiles. Where they got the Clan-XL Engine from though, that's a mystery - Hell, it even has a full SLDF-spec Warfare Suite. This 'Mech is filled with a solid mix of IS and Clan technology to make an actual nightmare. Don't ask me about the name of this Mech we've started calling "Number 3". It's got 13 threes in its 17-digit serial number and the number '3' carved into the emergency ejection button.
