content.original:
The Blink Cat, dont ask me why its called like that, is a very unusual Refit from the Blood Spirit Clan. Having a Shield is the first thing that Suprises me, considering Shields are nowhere to be seen by Clanners anyway. Next thing is the Unusual weapons loadout, aswell as some Shoulder and Arm Upgrades. As a Whole, this Mech seems not in the Spirit of Clan warfare, but the Blood Spirit Clan were isolationists, so i guess they got it from there. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: Armed with Dual UAC5's in the Right Arm, supported by a Specially modified shoulder to absorb the Recoil better, This Nova Cat is Very dangerous Boss. The Right Torso also Sports Streak LRM's and a Guardian ECM. The Left Torso has 2 Pulse Lasers and a Probe in it. The Left Arm Has a Shield, this makes me Question Things. All in All, this Mech seems Extremely out of Touch for Clanners, even if it was made by Blood Spirits.

content.original: A wealthy Davion household once used one of the Prototype Ostlords to make a mock-up Knight from the Ancient Times. A 14T Vibrosword and 15T Shield form its entire primary armament. 15 rockets in each torso give it a one time ranged attack, and to close up the distance it has a Supercharger installed. The Armour and Structure have both been Reinforced, there's even more Modular Armouron top of that. A C3 Slave, AR-12 and UAV give the allies of this frontline monster all the help they need in the fight. the rest of the cockpit has been upgraded to take a beating as well, so knocking it down wont hurt the pilot... probably. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: Like many of the SLDF's Gunslinger 'Mechs, the Panther GSR was high on the list for any potential upgrades, owing to its prestigeous status. Advancements in both laser and Streak SRM technologies found their way snugly onto the chassis, with the ER Large Laser being refit to Clan specifications, and the Streak SRMs being once more merged into a larger launcher with the newer Streak SRM-6. The rest of the 'Mech remained the same, carrying a modest 10 Double Heat Sinks and the typical quartet of jump jets. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
The owner of this Penthesilea was in cahoots with some Clanners, having acquired tons of Clantech to upgrade the 'Mech. Two UAC/5s and one UAC/2 give it good long range weaponry, supported by pre-Clan lasers, wherever they sourced those from. Two machine gun arrays deter any Battle Armor. The electronics on this thing are exceptional as well, with a Bloodhound Probe and Angel ECM clan providing excellent offense and defense, respectively. the cockpit has been entirely reworked, though to a lesser extent than the other parts of this 'Mech. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: A factory level refit of the Pulverizer 3R. This model upgrades all the weaponry to improved Clan designs, in addition to swapping the locations to ones the commissioner considered to be "more aesthetically pleasing". Perhaps the focus on form over function is what prevented this design from taking off. Or perhaps it was the utter annihilation of the creators of the 'Mech, Clan Wolverine. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original: Not often you find one of these, Boss; this is a custom job, for sure. None of the Pulverizers I've ever heard of ran a full compliment of this kind of weaponry. She pales in comparison to what the Clans field today, but back in her day I bet she was a force to be reckoned with.

content.original: Changing the Endo Steel on this Quickdraw Might seem Excessive, but the Benefits outgrow the Problems it Brings. 'Stormer' or so this mech is called, Comes with some Clan Upgrades over Inner Sphere ones and it Shows how Dangerous it now is. The Enhanced Imaging and the Clan XL Engine make it a Dangerous Foe. Dont ask how its got its Name, I cant find anything why this is supposed to be Special, it doesnt make the Weather bad. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: The Endo Steel, Enhanced Imaging, Active Probe and XL engine are all Clan made, everything else is Innersphere Tech. One Rotary AC5 and a MRM30 launcher, coupled with 2 Medium Xpulse laser Make it a Threat on the Battlefield. 12 Double Heatsinks Cool this Mech Down, but its still kinda Hot. Wait... what the hell is that? Why is there a Streak SRM Launcher ON the Arm, not IN it?

content.original: Refitted for the Front line Warriors that did not like the Original Concept, This Rabid Coyote variant now Fields 36 Tubes of Streak SRM's, and 2 complementary Small Pulse Lasers. Not alot has changed otherwise, Still the same amount of Armour and Speed. 4 Tons of Ammo supply this Mech with enough Firepower, while the Upgrades make sure that the Streaks are Faster at Target Acquisiton. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original:
This Mech, apparently Won Through a Batchall against Clanners, was Mildly Upgraded with Inner Sphere Tech. Each Arm has a Clan RAC5 and a Small Xpulse Laser, the Torso has a MRM10 each. With enough Ammo to Last Two Battles, this Rifleman still serves its Original Purpose. It's fast and Armoured too, with a Serious Ewar Package. Dont think this Clan mech is as Feeble as its Predecessors. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: While the Armament might look a bit Small, believe me that for a 65Ton Mech, its scary enough. 2 RAC5's 2 MRM10's make a good Dent in any mech, while the 2 Small Xpulses make sure no pesky Infantry come close to it. The Bloodhound and Clan Guardian ECM give it a Very nice Ewar Package, Combined with the reduced but still respectable Speed, its nothing to Laugh at Boss.

content.original: This very expensively upgraded Roughneck came from a militia man turned Solaris Gladiator. Mixed Clan and Inner Sphere tech makes this a marvel of technology, with a Battle Rifle in one hand and a heavy shield in the other. It has a MRM40 and Narc to round out its weaponry, while heavily reinforced reactive armour makes this a very tough opponent. This 'Mech was a labour of love, for both its Mechwarrior and MekTek. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: I know I give the Clans a lotta flak for ruining what ain't broke, but this time I think they might've been onto something. No unnecessary bullshit here, just a straight continuation of what the Shadow Hawk used to be. Top marks - for a Clan design, anyway.

content.original: An ambitious and expensive refit of the Shadow Hawk, the 2HC saw limited success in border skirmishes between the Terran Hegemony and House Liao during the unrest following the Amaris Civil War. The moniker "Here's 'Caid" stems from an urban brawl where the 2HC successfully flanked a gun emplacement by bursting through a wall. The phrase was allegedly yelled over loudspeaker by the pilot. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: This Rare Factory refit brings the Spirit walker Closer to its Descendant, the Black Knight. Now with Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous, this Unusual Refit is made thanks to OmniMech Technology. With a Gauss Rifle in each Arm, and a LRM 15 and SRM 6 Launcher in each Torso, this Spirit Walker Configuration was made for Back line Sniping, something Unusual in Clan Culture. However, being made by Clan Blood Spirit, everything about this Mech is unusual anyway, as their Isolationist ways have changed their Clan Lifestyle to a degree. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: Built with nearly Same Mindset as the Other Spirit Walkers, the symmetrical Loadout gives this Spirit Walker one Hell of a Punch. A Gauss Rifle, SRM6 and LRM15 Launcher per side make it even scarier than the normal ones. While not Faster, it has Even more Armour than before, so even the Occasional shots in the Back are Shrugged off by this Mech. The only Downside to this Variant is the ammo Dependancy, which as it stands, might be the only Weakness.

content.original:
The Stag BattleMech was among the last produced by Clan Wolverine before its annihilation, making customised versions such as "Antler" truly one-of-a-kind. Assumed to have been piloted by a bloodnamed MechWarrior, "Antler" boasts what was the cutting edge in Clan technology at the time, eschewing the usual ER Large Laser in favour of a short-ranged Large Pulse Laser, along with other upgrades to the weaponry. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The Stalker GSR was widely regarded as one of the most equipped of the Gunslinger's known refits. Once settled in Clan space, it was set upon by Clan technicians and scientists, each working out how they could cram yet more destructive power into the eighty-five ton chassis. The result was a full upgrade to the weapons, bringing each system to the cutting edge of Clan technology. With the weight saved, three jump jets were added to aid in mobility over rough terrain, a complaint often given by the original pilot. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.25

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
content.prevOriginal:

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
content.content:
Stalker GSR считался одним из самых технически оснащённых среди всех известных рефитов Gunslinger. Как только он обосновался в пространстве Кланов, над ним начали работать клановские техники и учёные, каждый из которых пытался найти способ вместить в 85-тонное шасси ещё больше разрушительной мощи. В результате была проведена полная модернизация вооружения, каждая система оказалась на острие клановских технологий. Благодаря уменьшению веса были добавлены три прыжковых двигателя, чтобы облегчить передвижение по пересечённой местности, на что часто жаловались прошлые пилоты. Особенность: Боевой компьютер Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.25

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A Costly, but important Refit of the Aging Stalker Chassis. Whoever made this Refit kep the 75tons of Mech, but Upgraded them to Resemble a normal Stalker. After 'donating' a whole Warehouse full of these Old Stalkers, one of the Free Worlds League breakaway State Refitted these things to Combat Capabilities. Gotta give it to them though, this Looks like a Proper Stalker if you just Glance at them. Nothing too Expensive is on these Stalkers Either to be fair, its just having Restored these from Mothballed to Functioning must've been a Huge Money Sink. Wonder who would do something stupid. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.content:
Дорогой, но важный рефит стареющего шасси «Сталкер». Тот, кто сделал эту модификацию, сохранил 75-тонность меха, но модернизировал его так, что тот стал похож на обычного «Сталкера». После «пожертвования» целого склада, полного старых «Сталкеров», одно из государств, отколовшихся от Лиги Свободных Миров, переоборудовало их до боевого состояния. Надо отдать им должное: если просто взглянуть на них, они выглядят как нормальные «Сталкеры». Если честно, в них нет ничего дорогостоящего, просто их восстановление из законсервированного состояния в работоспособное, должно быть, влетело в копеечку. Интересно, кто бы мог совершить такую глупость. Особенность: Боевой компьютер Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.17

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Making these Stalker Functioning again cost a Fortune, but they are very Serviceable Missile Boats boss. 3 LRM20's Clanspec give it enough missiles, while 6 Medium XPulse Lasers ensure its not to be trifled with in short Range. The Structure is the same, the Armour has Light Ferro on it, whilst also being uparmored. The Engine was changed into a Light, and the 16 Double Heatsinks ensure this is able to Fire all its weapons without too many Problems.
content.prevOriginal: Making these Stalker Functioning again cost a Fortune, but they are very Serviceable Missile Boats boss. 3 LRM20's Clanspec give it enough missiles, while 6 Medium XPulse Lasers ensure its not to be trifled with in short Range. The Structure is the same, the Armour has Light Ferro on it, whilst also being uparmored. The Engine was changed into a Light, and the 16 Double Heatsinks ensure this is able to Fire all its weapons without too many Problems.
content.content: Заставить эти «Сталкеры» снова работать стоило целое состояние, но зато теперь это очень удобные ракетоносители. 3 клановые LRM-20 выдают внушительный залп, а 6 средних XPulse-лазера позволяют не беспокоиться о ближнем бое. Каркас остался прежним, броня - лёгкое ферроволокно, но - усиленное. Двигатель был заменен на лёгкий, а 16 двойных охладителей позволяют меху без особых проблем стрелять из всех стволов.

content.original:
The Stayslayer GSR refit saw something of a return to form when experimented on by the Clans. With improvements to laser technology, the Starslayer GSR was outfitted with the cutting edge of weapon improvements in two Improved Large Pulse Lasers, and a prototype ER Small Laser. Likewise, the aging pair of Streak SRM-2s were swapped out for a newer Streak SRM-4 prototype model. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: This Mech, as you could already tell from the Name, comes from a Wealthy Family that owned a Very old Stinger. Refitting it in Current Times, This Old Design got Clantech Installed while still retaining some Inner Sphere Technology. The Weapons are Considerably upgraded, just like the Engine and as Such, this Mech is a Fearsome Scout. A Questionable IFF Package mixed with a Special Sensor make this Mech have Quasi Ewar, while not fielding a Probe or ECM. All in All, i would say this is a Good one, Boss. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: A Light Engine with a 140 Core Make this Stinger faster than its Predecessors. More Armour and Clan Endo Steel make Sure it can fit all of the Upgrades, while the Weapons make sure it stays where its supposed to. 16 Double Heatsinks Cool this stinger, additionally the Lasers are all connected to Laser insulators. This Mech would be a goddamn Sauna if not for all of this. Oh, and dont forget the Laser AMS, gotta stop those LRM's somehow.

content.original: The Sun Bear is best known as the progenitor design for the Stooping Hawk. Originally named the Prototype A, it was developed by Clan Ghost Bear as a competitor of the Stormcrow and Mad Dog designs. Eschewing bulky equipment like ferro-fibrous armor and an Endo Steel chassis, it instead used an XL engine to provide 24 tons of pod space. This was less than the pod space of the Mad Dog but slightly more than the Stormcrow. Despite these advantages, the Sun Bear ultimately was not favored by Clan Ghost Bear. The Prototype As entered service under the name of Sun Bear. The design was beloved by its pilots and it frequently went to the most aggressive pilots in the Bear touman.

Originally named the Prototype A, it was developed by Clan Ghost Bear as a competitor of the Stormcrow and Mad Dog designs. Eschewing bulky equipment like ferro-fibrous armor and an Endo Steel chassis, it instead used an XL engine to provide 24 tons of pod space. This was less than the pod space of the Mad Dog but slightly more than the Stormcrow. Despite these advantages, the Sun Bear ultimately was not favored by Clan Ghost Bear. The Prototype As entered service under the name of Sun Bear. The design was beloved by its pilots and it frequently went to the most aggressive pilots in the Bear touman.

content.original: I can respect when somebody orders a custom job on a 'Mech and they don't ask you to replace every little thing on it. The LB-10-X here slots nicely into where the AC-10 used to be, and those Streak SRMs sit nice and pretty in the old LRM-5 mounts. Feels like an homage to the original — like there's some respect for it.

content.original: Named after a Species of Spiders on Terra, this Tarantula has nothing else in common with their Counterpart. Looking at the Interior, this Tarantula has been in good Care and use. Nearly all of the Things have been Refitted to Clantech, and as such the Tarantula you see here is a Real Fighter. Not as Fast as its Counterparts, it fields an Impressive Array of Weapons, most notably that Clan Plasma Cannon. Dont look over the Armour, its been Increased aswell. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: This Tarantula was Designed for Counter Scouting. While not as Fast or Nimble, the Weapons would make short work of any other Scout, while taking a lot of fire. The Clan XL with a 150 Core makes enough space for One Plasma Cannon, A Lrm 10 Clan launcher and a Medium Pulse Laser. There is also a Heavy MG for Anti Personnel Purposes with enough ammo to last a While. 14 Tons of Clan Heatsinks make it Cooler than Cool.

content.original: This Thunder Stallion was named after Dragoons, ancient Terran warriors that rode to battle on horseback to then dismount and fight on foot. Some History buff named this Mech, don't ask me where he learned all that history from though. This Thunder Stallion comes equipped with a Heavy PPC, one Heavy Gauss Rifle and two Clan LRM20's. While not as fast as its namesake, this thing will still provide ample support from the rear or flanks. It can be counted on to do this well, with Sniper Sensors for eyes and an Angel ECM for ears. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.27

content.original:
A customised model, this RQA-B was one of the original prototypes, built prior to the first production run. Full of technological upgrades that never made it into production, this mech is equally deadly at range and close quarters. Featuring 3 PPC’s, first generation heat dissipation armour and a unique FCS built to maximise the damage potential of the weapons; this Urbanmech has claimed many unwary opponents. Piloted by one of Damage Inc’s senior officers, this mech is equally notorious among Damage Inc’s opponents and allies. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Valkyrie II project originated as an assignment for two NAIS student design teams to create a new heavy scout and skirmisher mech based on the Valkyrie VLK-QA. A rivalry between the two teams and outside pressures from Davion bureaucrats pushed both designs far beyond a replacement for the VLK-QA. Achernar BattleMechs was contracted to construct the Valkyrie II-1A which sports a Hermes 360XL Engine, six Jump Jets, an ER PPC, a LRM10, and over eleven tons of armor. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: I heard of this project; it was pretty bad, lot's of money changing hands and lot's of competing design requirements. It's a miracle these things ever made it to production. I will say this, the Valkyrie II is faster than the original despite being twice the weight while carrying a stronger weapons and armor compliment. It may not excel at anything in particular but it can work for most jobs it is tasked with.

content.original: This former Volkh-7 was heavily customized after being smuggled off Solaris VII. The lances have been upgraded to ludicrous proportions and most of the weapons and targeting systems have been torn out to make room for these "magshot lances." It'll definitely put a hole in someone's armor, assuming you can keep it standing up. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: The Volkh was originally designed on Solaris VII by Vining Engineering and Salvage Team to serve as a testbed for advanced technology. THIS setup seems to be a testbed for how many "lances" some mechjockey could control at once. There's a lengthy poem in some archaic Terran language carved all throughout the cockpit.

content.original:
A far cry from the most popular of the Gunslinger refits, the Whitworth was still held in high enough regard to eventually recieve the upgrades. Thankfully, the long delay allowed it to skip the awkward early prototypes of larger Streak SRM launchers, and be refitted with some of the first models of the perfected designs. The rest of the 'Mech remained largely unchanged, with the Chameleon Light Polarization System still intact despite the exodus. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
According to the onboard files, this Mech was previously owned by a Kuritan Ronin. From what I can tell, it looks like a field-upgraded version of the Yeoman-6K. It was built to use the biggest punches available, utilizing MRM40s equipped with Ares-Avenger Apollo missile guidance systems. The addition of a Supercharger makes it more mobile, while the FCS has been entirely replaced to make the missiles more resistant to AMS. There is also an advanced communications suite in here, paired with a standard Beagle Active Probe. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. A ClanTech redesign of the Zeus-X chassis replacing some of its electronics and all its 'Tech with Clan upgraded versions. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.27

content.original: The Eridani Light Horse Atlas D refit, lovingly named "Corporal", saw extensive deployments during the Hegemony Campaign as a Command 'Mech that was able to keep stride with a skirmishing lance. Armed with two Defiance LB 10-X autocannons, 2 Raker-IV Medium Lasers, and 3 Holly SRM6 launchers backed by Artemis IV controllers, the Corporal needed little in the way of babysitting. A total of 12 double heat sinks manage the weaponry effectively in short bursts. Unfortunately, due to its almost complete dependency on ammunition, the model was quickly retired as the campaign dragged on. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original:
The Black Watch was originally constructed to show the production capabilities of the new Second Star League. Debuting in 3061, this 85 ton behemoth was designed as a spiritual successor to the Crockett- a classic assault mech used by the original SLDF. This particular refit package, which started being offered in 3073, retrofits many of the standard Inner-Sphere weapons, favoring Clan-tech equivalents. Its primary weapons are a pair of arm mounted Clan UAC-10s, backed up by a pair of shoulder mounted MRM launchers. It does boast advanced sensors and FCS systems alongside upgraded actuators and recoil dampeners. While sporting a clan-tech endo-steel chassis, its 'Achilles' Heel is its Inner-Sphere Strand-225 XL engine. But with twenty tons of armor, the -LRG makes for a perfect line-breaker. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original: This, arguably, Sidegrade of a Bombardier still does the Job it was supposed to do. Now armed with 4 MML's instead of a mix of SRM's and LRM launchers, it still gets the Support Role done. You can see a whole Plethora of ideas were included into this Refit, but im not too sure how its going to work out. According to all Sources i can find, This was built somewhere in the FWL just before they Fragmented, so they probably slapped on whatever they had and went to War with it. The name doesnt Ring a bell though, i have to wonder what it means. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Named after a mythological Pirate from pre-spaceflight Terra, the Buccaneer was born from the early days of the Great Schism between ComStar and Word of Blake. The Buccaneer was an odd mech from the get go. Built from the desperate need for mechs, any mechs, cost wasn't a driving factor. Often equipped with XL engines, Ferro-Fibrous armor, and more upgrades, these mechs were churned out to WoB mechwarriors at rapid rates in the early stages of the Jihad. Its unique silhouette and almost always carrying a melee weapon, is often why they are referred to as "Centurions with a hatchet..." Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
The Centurion OmniMech was born out of a desire on the part of Corean Enterprises to expand the company's market share. Manufactured primarily at the Corean Enterprises' site on New Avalon and weighing in at 50 tons, the Centurion mounted a Magna 250 XL engine, allowing it to run at 86 km/h, and mounts nine and a half tons of standard armor. With ten fixed double heat sinks, the Centurion has 24 tons of pod space available, almost half the total weight of the 'Mech, and the most common variants of the Centurion echo the various variants of the original Centurion BattleMech developed over the centuries. Quirk: Yen Lo Wang Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.content:
Омнимех Centurion появился на свет благодаря стремлению Corean Enterprises расширить свою долю на рынке. Изготовленный в основном на заводе Corean Enterprises на Новом Авалоне и весящий 50 тонн, этот Centurion оснащен двигателем Magna 250 XL, позволяющий ему двигаться 86 км/ч, и имеет 9,5 тонн стандартной брони. С 10 фиксированными двойными радиаторами у Centurion остаётся 24 тонны места под вооружение, что почти половина общей массы меха. Наиболее распространенные варианты повторяют различные варианты оригинального Centurion. Особенность: Yen Lo Wang Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

content.original:
This Chimera was handled by a literal maniac. It has Wings, still looks as bad as before and has questionable upgrades. Nearly everything weapons-related was removed, save for a single array of tiny lasers. The legs have been taken care of a lot more than you would think, they even have protective armour pieces in there. Spikes strewn about the whole goddamn 'Mech don't make it easy to maintain. Don't even ask me where they got a working DNI. I don't want to find out; this Mech scares me. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
As a PPC-toting 'Mech, the Gunslinger Cicada refit was undertaken by Clan Wolverine. While the Clan's Enhanced PPCs were significantly ahead of the original Star League Snub-Nose variants, the increased weight necessitated the transfer of the design to a full Endo-Steel chassis. The resulting loadout ran blisteringly hot over extended deployment, prompting the development of more efficient cooling jackets to mitigate the problem without adding even further bulk. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A special refit for a Star Colonel in the Snow Raven military, this Deimos was called 'Air Superiority' even though it was unnecessary. Armed with six LBX/5s and two LBX/2s, its role was to shoot down any and all flying assets. Considering that almost nobody other than Clan Snow Raven was fielding a force of flying units, this Deimos didn't see much use. Nonetheless, it will certainly shred any flying hostile in its way. There is even a Bolt-On Anti Air Missile Pod - I would like to know how this Honorable Clanner got that on there without getting reprimanded. Not very Honorable, but who actually knows what that means. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: Developed in 3057, the 65 ton Dig Lord IndustrialMech is a heavier version of the older Dig King. As with many IndustrialMechs, "Hoxxes" was abandoned once its job was finished and then converted by local militia into a "servicable BattleMech." The result is a slow, clunky machine masquerading as a weapon of war — but, when it has heavy weaponry bolted to it, what's the difference? Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9

content.original:
Envisioned by Stefan Amaris for the Amaris Empire Armed Forces, the Dragoon was swiftly commissioned following the Amaris Coup. This particular Dragoon strays from the model's renowned modularity and instead doubles down on quad Ultra AC/5s and supporting systems, requiring a full endosteel skeleton in place of the ferro-fibrous armour. As such, the Dragoon 01F enjoys slightly less protection, relying instead on its longer range bracket to keep it safe. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
The original Emperor GSR was something of an oddity. The SLDF Gunslinger program was typically focused around duels, and the Emperor GSR was a Command 'Mech. This oddity apparently slipped under the radar, even to the Clans, who continued to overlook the obvious Command Console in favour of bringing the laser weapons up to spec. In addition, the machine guns were removed to reintegrate the classic trio of jump jets commonly seen on Emperors. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: This is one of Jalastar Aerospace's Gunsmith 'Mechs, greatly upgraded and retrofitted. The X-Pulses have been replaced with Medium Heavy Lasers, with a special FCS installed to help control the heat. A Clan-tech MASC and enormous XL engine ensure it's the fastest 'Mech on the battlefield, while the heavily upgraded arm actuators help hitting a shot on the run. Boss, this thing is extremely dangerous, and fast even for a light. Whoever used this 'Mech must have been one hell of a crack shot to hit anything at these speeds. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original:
This cheerfully named 'Murder' Hornet has been touched by a Mad Genius. Unsure if it belongs to one of the crazies of Solaris or even a Manei Domini pilot, this Hornet was upgraded so extensively it's barely recognizable. An advanced Void System with a Signature Damper make it incredibly tough to spot, and a supercharged light engine keeps it extremely mobile. A bevy of Micro Pulse Laser Arrays replace the traditional weaponry, and the entire cockpit has been refitted to make space for a lostech AR12 Suite. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: Originally developed by Clan Fire Mandrill during the Golden Century, the 20-ton Howler is a light support mech. Built around a 150-rated Fusion Core the Howler uses a combination of Heavy Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel; allowing the Mech to carry 9-ATM's with 1.5 tons of ammo in a shoulder Turret. The additional Tonnage went into two Small lasers,one in the Left Arm and the other in the Head, aswell as Additional Heatsinks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
A quick and dirty modernisation of an ICR-1S Icarus II, this customised model swaps out the autocannon and ammo to double down on energy weapons with a Heavy PPC and appropriate cooling. Likewise, the medium lasers have been replaced with longer-range X-Pulse versions. The addition of a targeting computer and sensors dialed in for ranging makes this BattleMech deadly at long range. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The 'Golden' Jackal is a Upgrade to a minor Degree. What makes it Golden, is the change from one PPC to 2 Light PPC's and a Streak SRM 6. Quick enough and Armed with a Narc (c) and Guardian, this Jackal is able to Hunt down most of its Foes, and still provide Support if needed. This Chassis hasnt seen much fighting, as it was only encountered in the Provisionary Kittery Prefecture. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
During the first wave of Clan invasions many worlds fell in rapid succession, with the fighting fierce and unrelenting it would only be a matter of time for civic facilities to fall in the hands of the Clan onslaught. One casualty was the main branch distillery of the 'Stieglitz-Bradford Kräuter Liqör' a.k.a the Jaegermeister manufacturer of the 30th century. Taking this as a personal defacement of the finer Lyran spirit of things, one outstanding and mostly rich-beyond-means noble took it upon himself to rectify this issue one Clanner Star at a time. From a debaucherous amount of C-bills this fevered machine came to be, named the 'Jaegermeister' as a tribute to the beloved drink. Equipped with everything a hunter needs, from anti-bird-splatter AMS systems to a faithful hunting hawk drone, it brings dual HVAC/10s to bear on the uncouth Clanners who would not respect its namesake. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
This Jenner was first fielded in 2784, the same year the Exodus fleet that would eventually become the Clans left the Inner Sphere. How exactly they acquired this design in that short time frame is not known, but what is known is that it belonged to a Kuritan lieutenant. The name translates to 'Fast', or 'the First'. Looking at the Specs of this 'Mech, it definitely fills that Role. The speed of this 'Mech, together with its upgrades, leaves me to believe this was designed to ram its opponents. There are spikes on every part, upgraded Leg Actuators, and Protective Padding all over the whole 'Mech. All of the electronics have been upgraded to support the calculations and projections needed in melee combat. If it can't ram, it has just two micro lasers to fall back on. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The JR7-IICV was designed to guard the flanks of heavy and assault mechs when fighting combined arms inner sphere forces. It's more heavily armored than most Clan Jenners which gives it improved survivability in heavy combat zones. It's main weapons are a set of machine guns which make quick work of conventional infantry and light vehicles. A pair of heavy medium lasers give it some focused anti-armor punch. Although the design proved effective an unfortunate meme dubbing it a ''Joust tank with legs'' lessened it's popularity among Clan mechwarriors who eschew anything related to armored fighting vehicles and infantry. This mech's intended role does not lend itself to gaining personal glory. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - MG Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The Kiso was created as a "command" construction vehicle for large planetary construction projects. Somebody in the Periphery decided that enough was enough, and thus the "Periphery Rising" was born. Most of the original construction equipment has been stripped out, leaving only the communications suite, which has since been dialed in for coordinating lances of BattleMechs, rather than construction vehicles. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390-rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. This Linebacker was built around the Rising Problems that Battle Armour and Proto Mechs showed on the Battlefield. 14 Anti Personnel Gauss Rifles Obliterate anything that comes close to this Mech due to Volume of Fire, while the MASC ensures it has the Speed to Keep up with even Lights. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The 'Great Guardian of the 5th Heavenly Gate' as this Lu Wei Bing is called, is an extensive refit of the already great Lu Wei Bing. The Liao fanatic that made this thing happen tried to recreate a Legendary Creature, or Man, depending on how you look at it. Four RAC/2s, an MRM-10 and a single SRM-6 make this a mixed-range generalist. CASE 2 protects both torsos, while the specialized cockpit supports the autocannons for maximum efficiency. A C3 unit, advanced sensors and Clan Guardian ECM help this 'Mech stand out in the electronics department, while BoltOn LAA missiles help it against those pesky Fliers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original:
A very unpopular, and very expensive, refit package for a Marian Hegemony produced Marauder-4HB. Adding tons of electronic warfare gear to complement fifty-four iATM tubes with enough ammo to win any afternoon engagement. Forteen Clan Double Heat Sinks and a clan exchanger keep the mech ice cold- much like the nerve of the few pilots to pilot this mixed tech monstrosity. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original:
Practically the posterchild of the SLDF's Gunslingers, the prized Marauder GSR refit was eagerly adopted as a platform for weapons research by Clan scientists. When the Improved Gauss Rifle was developed, no time was wasted in replacing the aging LB-10-X Autocannon of the original design. Alongside the new Gauss armament are carried further improvements to the Clan's PPC and laser technologies. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: One of Norse-Storm's greatest creations, the original Nightstar began recirculating in the waning hours of the Federated Commonwealth. While popular in both Davion and Steiner territories post FedCom civil war, this particular one was acquired by a former Marik House Guardsman. Refitted with four Light-Gauss rifles, a Marik classic, this behemoth's complement would give many mech jockeys nightmares. Judging by the lack of damage to it- a lot of encounters with this mech ended in a one sided pull of the trigger. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

content.original:
The Blink Cat, dont ask me why its called like that, is a very unusual Refit from the Blood Spirit Clan. Having a Shield is the first thing that Suprises me, considering Shields are nowhere to be seen by Clanners anyway. Next thing is the Unusual weapons loadout, aswell as some Shoulder and Arm Upgrades. As a Whole, this Mech seems not in the Spirit of Clan warfare, but the Blood Spirit Clan were isolationists, so i guess they got it from there. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: A wealthy Davion household once used one of the Prototype Ostlords to make a mock-up Knight from the Ancient Times. A 14T Vibrosword and 15T Shield form its entire primary armament. 15 rockets in each torso give it a one time ranged attack, and to close up the distance it has a Supercharger installed. The Armour and Structure have both been Reinforced, there's even more Modular Armouron top of that. A C3 Slave, AR-12 and UAV give the allies of this frontline monster all the help they need in the fight. the rest of the cockpit has been upgraded to take a beating as well, so knocking it down wont hurt the pilot... probably. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: Like many of the SLDF's Gunslinger 'Mechs, the Panther GSR was high on the list for any potential upgrades, owing to its prestigeous status. Advancements in both laser and Streak SRM technologies found their way snugly onto the chassis, with the ER Large Laser being refit to Clan specifications, and the Streak SRMs being once more merged into a larger launcher with the newer Streak SRM-6. The rest of the 'Mech remained the same, carrying a modest 10 Double Heat Sinks and the typical quartet of jump jets. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
The owner of this Penthesilea was in cahoots with some Clanners, having acquired tons of Clantech to upgrade the 'Mech. Two UAC/5s and one UAC/2 give it good long range weaponry, supported by pre-Clan lasers, wherever they sourced those from. Two machine gun arrays deter any Battle Armor. The electronics on this thing are exceptional as well, with a Bloodhound Probe and Angel ECM clan providing excellent offense and defense, respectively. the cockpit has been entirely reworked, though to a lesser extent than the other parts of this 'Mech. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: A factory level refit of the Pulverizer 3R. This model upgrades all the weaponry to improved Clan designs, in addition to swapping the locations to ones the commissioner considered to be "more aesthetically pleasing". Perhaps the focus on form over function is what prevented this design from taking off. Or perhaps it was the utter annihilation of the creators of the 'Mech, Clan Wolverine. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

'Stormer' or so this mech is called, Comes with some Clan Upgrades over Inner Sphere ones and it Shows how Dangerous it now is. The Enhanced Imaging and the Clan XL Engine make it a Dangerous Foe. Dont ask how its got its Name, I cant find anything why this is supposed to be Special, it doesnt make the Weather bad. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
This Mech, apparently Won Through a Batchall against Clanners, was Mildly Upgraded with Inner Sphere Tech. Each Arm has a Clan RAC5 and a Small Xpulse Laser, the Torso has a MRM10 each. With enough Ammo to Last Two Battles, this Rifleman still serves its Original Purpose. It's fast and Armoured too, with a Serious Ewar Package. Dont think this Clan mech is as Feeble as its Predecessors. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: This very expensively upgraded Roughneck came from a militia man turned Solaris Gladiator. Mixed Clan and Inner Sphere tech makes this a marvel of technology, with a Battle Rifle in one hand and a heavy shield in the other. It has a MRM40 and Narc to round out its weaponry, while heavily reinforced reactive armour makes this a very tough opponent. This 'Mech was a labour of love, for both its Mechwarrior and MekTek. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: An ambitious and expensive refit of the Shadow Hawk, the 2HC saw limited success in border skirmishes between the Terran Hegemony and House Liao during the unrest following the Amaris Civil War. The moniker "Here's 'Caid" stems from an urban brawl where the 2HC successfully flanked a gun emplacement by bursting through a wall. The phrase was allegedly yelled over loudspeaker by the pilot. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: This Rare Factory refit brings the Spirit walker Closer to its Descendant, the Black Knight. Now with Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous, this Unusual Refit is made thanks to OmniMech Technology. With a Gauss Rifle in each Arm, and a LRM 15 and SRM 6 Launcher in each Torso, this Spirit Walker Configuration was made for Back line Sniping, something Unusual in Clan Culture. However, being made by Clan Blood Spirit, everything about this Mech is unusual anyway, as their Isolationist ways have changed their Clan Lifestyle to a degree. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original:
The Stag BattleMech was among the last produced by Clan Wolverine before its annihilation, making customised versions such as "Antler" truly one-of-a-kind. Assumed to have been piloted by a bloodnamed MechWarrior, "Antler" boasts what was the cutting edge in Clan technology at the time, eschewing the usual ER Large Laser in favour of a short-ranged Large Pulse Laser, along with other upgrades to the weaponry. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

Assumed to have been piloted by a bloodnamed MechWarrior, "Antler" boasts what was the cutting edge in Clan technology at the time, eschewing the usual ER Large Laser in favour of a short-ranged Large Pulse Laser, along with other upgrades to the weaponry. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The Stalker GSR was widely regarded as one of the most equipped of the Gunslinger's known refits. Once settled in Clan space, it was set upon by Clan technicians and scientists, each working out how they could cram yet more destructive power into the eighty-five ton chassis. The result was a full upgrade to the weapons, bringing each system to the cutting edge of Clan technology. With the weight saved, three jump jets were added to aid in mobility over rough terrain, a complaint often given by the original pilot. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.25

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
content.prevOriginal:

With the weight saved, three jump jets were added to aid in mobility over rough terrain, a complaint often given by the original pilot. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.25

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper
content.content:
Stalker GSR считался одним из самых технически оснащённых среди всех известных рефитов Gunslinger. Как только он обосновался в пространстве Кланов, над ним начали работать клановские техники и учёные, каждый из которых пытался найти способ вместить в 85-тонное шасси ещё больше разрушительной мощи. В результате была проведена полная модернизация вооружения, каждая система оказалась на острие клановских технологий. Благодаря уменьшению веса были добавлены три прыжковых двигателя, чтобы облегчить передвижение по пересечённой местности, на что часто жаловались прошлые пилоты. Особенность: Боевой компьютер Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.25

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A Costly, but important Refit of the Aging Stalker Chassis. Whoever made this Refit kep the 75tons of Mech, but Upgraded them to Resemble a normal Stalker. After 'donating' a whole Warehouse full of these Old Stalkers, one of the Free Worlds League breakaway State Refitted these things to Combat Capabilities. Gotta give it to them though, this Looks like a Proper Stalker if you just Glance at them. Nothing too Expensive is on these Stalkers Either to be fair, its just having Restored these from Mothballed to Functioning must've been a Huge Money Sink. Wonder who would do something stupid. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.content:
Дорогой, но важный рефит стареющего шасси «Сталкер». Тот, кто сделал эту модификацию, сохранил 75-тонность меха, но модернизировал его так, что тот стал похож на обычного «Сталкера». После «пожертвования» целого склада, полного старых «Сталкеров», одно из государств, отколовшихся от Лиги Свободных Миров, переоборудовало их до боевого состояния. Надо отдать им должное: если просто взглянуть на них, они выглядят как нормальные «Сталкеры». Если честно, в них нет ничего дорогостоящего, просто их восстановление из законсервированного состояния в работоспособное, должно быть, влетело в копеечку. Интересно, кто бы мог совершить такую глупость. Особенность: Боевой компьютер Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.17

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Stayslayer GSR refit saw something of a return to form when experimented on by the Clans. With improvements to laser technology, the Starslayer GSR was outfitted with the cutting edge of weapon improvements in two Improved Large Pulse Lasers, and a prototype ER Small Laser. Likewise, the aging pair of Streak SRM-2s were swapped out for a newer Streak SRM-4 prototype model. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: This Mech, as you could already tell from the Name, comes from a Wealthy Family that owned a Very old Stinger. Refitting it in Current Times, This Old Design got Clantech Installed while still retaining some Inner Sphere Technology. The Weapons are Considerably upgraded, just like the Engine and as Such, this Mech is a Fearsome Scout. A Questionable IFF Package mixed with a Special Sensor make this Mech have Quasi Ewar, while not fielding a Probe or ECM. All in All, i would say this is a Good one, Boss. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: Named after a Species of Spiders on Terra, this Tarantula has nothing else in common with their Counterpart. Looking at the Interior, this Tarantula has been in good Care and use. Nearly all of the Things have been Refitted to Clantech, and as such the Tarantula you see here is a Real Fighter. Not as Fast as its Counterparts, it fields an Impressive Array of Weapons, most notably that Clan Plasma Cannon. Dont look over the Armour, its been Increased aswell. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: This Thunder Stallion was named after Dragoons, ancient Terran warriors that rode to battle on horseback to then dismount and fight on foot. Some History buff named this Mech, don't ask me where he learned all that history from though. This Thunder Stallion comes equipped with a Heavy PPC, one Heavy Gauss Rifle and two Clan LRM20's. While not as fast as its namesake, this thing will still provide ample support from the rear or flanks. It can be counted on to do this well, with Sniper Sensors for eyes and an Angel ECM for ears. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.27

content.original:
A customised model, this RQA-B was one of the original prototypes, built prior to the first production run. Full of technological upgrades that never made it into production, this mech is equally deadly at range and close quarters. Featuring 3 PPC’s, first generation heat dissipation armour and a unique FCS built to maximise the damage potential of the weapons; this Urbanmech has claimed many unwary opponents. Piloted by one of Damage Inc’s senior officers, this mech is equally notorious among Damage Inc’s opponents and allies. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Valkyrie II project originated as an assignment for two NAIS student design teams to create a new heavy scout and skirmisher mech based on the Valkyrie VLK-QA. A rivalry between the two teams and outside pressures from Davion bureaucrats pushed both designs far beyond a replacement for the VLK-QA. Achernar BattleMechs was contracted to construct the Valkyrie II-1A which sports a Hermes 360XL Engine, six Jump Jets, an ER PPC, a LRM10, and over eleven tons of armor. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

A far cry from the most popular of the Gunslinger refits, the Whitworth was still held in high enough regard to eventually recieve the upgrades. Thankfully, the long delay allowed it to skip the awkward early prototypes of larger Streak SRM launchers, and be refitted with some of the first models of the perfected designs. content.original:
According to the onboard files, this Mech was previously owned by a Kuritan Ronin. From what I can tell, it looks like a field-upgraded version of the Yeoman-6K. It was built to use the biggest punches available, utilizing MRM40s equipped with Ares-Avenger Apollo missile guidance systems. The addition of a Supercharger makes it more mobile, while the FCS has been entirely replaced to make the missiles more resistant to AMS. There is also an advanced communications suite in here, paired with a standard Beagle Active Probe. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.content:
According to the onboard files, this Mech was previously owned by a Kuritan Ronin. From what I can tell, it looks like a field-upgraded version of the Yeoman-6K. It was built to use the biggest punches available, utilizing MRM40s equipped with Ares-Avenger Apollo missile guidance systems. The addition of a Supercharger makes it more mobile, while the FCS has been entirely replaced to make the missiles more resistant to AMS. There is also an advanced communications suite in here, paired with a standard Beagle Active Probe. Особенность: Точное оружие - Missiles Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.14

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. A ClanTech redesign of the Zeus-X chassis replacing some of its electronics and all its 'Tech with Clan upgraded versions. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.27

content.original: In the first age, in the first battle, when the shadows first lengthened, one stood. Burned by the embers of Armageddon, his soul blistered by the fires of Hell and tainted beyond ascension, he chose the path of perpetual torment. In his ravenous hatred he found no peace; and with boiling blood he scoured the Umbral Plains seeking vengeance against the dark lords who had wronged him. He wore the crown of the Night Sentinels, and those that tasted the bite of his sword named him... the Doom Slayer. Quirk: Industrial TSM Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: Another one of these 'Mechs of unknown origin, huh? We had a look over it, like you asked. Pretty strange stuff. Mixed technology all through the old girl, and somebody left a note in the cockpit that just says "hehe shonk".

content.original: The personal 'Mech of a Taurian Sheriff with multiple connections, this upgrade was commissioned as a Marshal as beautiful as the Taurians might have never seen. Mixed Clan and Inner Sphere tech makes it a deadly enforcer. Paired Clantech UAC/2s, Improved Medium Lasers and LRM/15s give it enough firepower and range to brawl or snipe, whichever the Sheriff so chose. Clan electronics and prototype heatsinks make sure he wouldn't be sweating too hard, either. According to 'Officials' and the onboard computer though, this was more of a Parade 'Mech rather than a Combat 'Mech. It looks like it could fight toe to toe with heavies, but the internal components are so hard to come by it would be sad to see it destroyed. The final log entry reads: 'This isn't about revenge. This is about justice.' Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: A Special Refit from the Escorpio Empire, Mixing Tech they had available at the Time. Clan Ultracannons, Medium lasers and MG's Round this Phoenix hawk off to a Good Start. A MASC gives it Good Speed, while a Single AMS protects it from Missiles. The most Special part about this Phoenix Hawk is the Ferro Lamellor, giving this Mech the edge it needs. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: Originally built as a new assault class mech by Clan Steel Viper just three years before the introduction of the Omnimech, the Phoenix Hawk IIC is based on the venerable 45 ton Phoenix Hawk but almost twice as heavy at 80 tons. The Phoenix Hawk IIC features as close as possible ground speed and agility to the original Phoenix Hawk making it an effective fast interdiction unit.

content.original: Originally intended as a Battlemech refitted for Industrial use. The Story goes basically: Mothballed Axeman got sold to some Contractor, he installed something for Crushing up Rocks and Digging around in a Mine. Then it was Turned into a 'SecurityMech' with some Upgrades. Not much is known how this Mech now being into Military Service back again. It also Looks like this was Permanently worked on, atleast in the Field. Many different people Worked on this. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: The Rockman is definitively Something Boss. Very Heavy Mace, paired with a Smaller Shield makes it Look more like a Solaris Mech. 4 Pulse Lasers in one, a Light AC10 in the Other Make the Torso's quite Crowded. An Angel ECM and a Bloodhound Probe give it Very nice Ewar, While a Upgraded XL Engine and a Supercharger Give it more Speed. Whoever built this Mech, had Money, Time and a Factory to Make this Happen to boot.

content.original: Crabs have a reputation for being hard to kill and this CRB-27 chassis has been heavily modified to maximize that natural durability. Massive amounts of Hardened armor cover every component, with Harjel ready to seal any cracks. Most of the weaponry has been moved inboard, out of the more vulnerable arms. This durability comes at the cost of reduced speed and firepower compared to an average Crab. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Named for some supposedly ancient Warrior of Terran mythology does this experimental No-Dachi carry a reforged Large Vibroblade and is equipped with advanced Myomer. Особенность: Way of the Samurai Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.12

content.original: A former Khan of Clan Star Adder, Bearing Bearingovich oversaw the clan's expansion from a relatively minor clan, into a power house within the Kerensky cluster. Although not able to translate that success into his attempts to claim territory within the Inner Sphere, Bearing none the less became one of the clan's most respected khans. A fierce military leader, Bearing was also well known for his knowledge of LosTech, even amongst the clans. Although clan records also record his dislike of advanced Star-League Era AI, including his relentless attempts to torture such an AI, known only as 'RogueBot'.  Bearing would eventually use his tech knowledge in the creation of his specialised suit of Rogue Bear Battle Armor, known as BA Baracas.  It is with the Baracas Battle Armor that Bearing Bearingovich would call for a Trial of Grievance against Hannibal Banacek for his right to reclaim the Banacek blood name.

content.original: Born of the Banacek and Talasko bloodlines, Hannibal was the only member of his sibko to graduate as a warrior. Despite his pro-Warden leanings and outspoken criticism of the Crusader ideology, which made him a target for many Trials early in his career, Hannibal's tactical skills ensured his challengers' failure even as he rose through the ranks. In 3057 he won the Banacek Bloodname and by 3059 was commanding the Fifth Assault Cluster in his Clan's Alpha Galaxy. In this prestigious post Banacek was repeatedly commended by his superiors for his resourcefulness and battlefield flair. During the Burrock Absorption it was under his command that the outnumbered 5th spearheaded the charge at Fort Weller which broke Clan Blood Spirit's defenses and forced them to withdraw from Albion.

content.original: Murdock Banacek is proficient in all forms of flying vehicles and mechs.  Passing his Trial of Position as a Star Commander, Murdock's obsession with being airborn soon had him taking any opportunity to get into the cockpit of anything that could lift him off the ground.  He was invovled in multiplie Trials of Grievance when his unclan-like methods and combat preferrences would ultimately insult another ranking clansman.

content.original: Templeton Banacek missed graduating from his sibko as full-fledged MechWarrior due to an lucky strike crippling the life support of his 'Mech and forcing him to abandon the Trial.  Relegated to the motorpool, Templeton used his wile and charisma to work his way up the ranks and becoming a Star Captain, commanding both 'Mech and Vehicle stars.  His ability to procure almost anything even when on remote battlefields allowed his Cluster to win most of their battles, even when sorely outnumbered and supplies were running low.

content.original: This MechWarrior came into your care after a successful hostage rescue mission. Having missed the last MedEvac Dropship operated by your then employer, the local Medics signed them over to your care. After a stint in the Argo's medical facilities, they eventually awakened, recalling their name as Carson 'Beam' Lightfoot. Their last recollection was evaccing from their tank following critical damage to the motive system leaving it a sitting duck.

After a stint in the Argo's medical facilities, they eventually awakened, recalling their name as Erika 'Throttle' Jones. Their last recollection was evaccing from their tank following critical damage to the motive system leaving it a sitting duck.

content.original: Alice Carter, known as "Nova", is a determined and agile MechWarrior hailing from New Avalon. Enamored by BattleMechs since childhood, she joined the Davion MechWarrior Academy, swiftly rising through the ranks with her lightning-fast reflexes and tactical brilliance. Despite a serious injury during combat, Alice's resilience prevailed, as she integrated cybernetic enhancements into her Mech, exemplifying unwavering bravery and inspiring her comrades in the Federated Suns' cause. On the battlefield, "Nova" remains a symbol of hope and an indomitable force.

content.original: Amanda grew up surrounded by battlemechs at a mercenary stronghold on Cassias, both her and her sister, Julia, were later trained rigorously at the renowned Blackstar Academy, becoming highly skilled MechWarriors. However, as their paths diverged, Amanda's bold and daring tactics led her to embrace the callsign "Firefly", while Julia, with her graceful and protective nature, adopted "Angel". Despite choosing separate careers, the sisters hold an unbreakable bond, and whenever they cross paths on the battlefield, a shimmer of kinship lights up the darkest moments of war..

content.original: Ava Rivers, a 26-year-old maverick, emerged as a brilliant and innovative MechWarrior.  Raised in the secretive enclaves of a clandestine tech guild, Ava's fascination with machines bordered on the obsessive.  Gifted with an uncanny knack for deciphering the arcane secrets of BattleMechs, she earned the evocative callsign "Flux" for her ability to manipulate the ebb and flow of combat like a cosmic choreographer. With her enigmatic skills, Ava has goals that transcend mere battlefield glory, she seeks to uncover the long-lost mysteries of the ancient WarTech, a journey that may one day reshape the power balance of the sector.

content.original: Ben Jager, a man both distant and haunted, callsign "Monster". A recluse amid rusting relics, he seems to have an unusual kinship with the colossal machines. Withdrawn from normal social interactions, but driven by a deep-seated love for BattleMechs, he has ventured into many interstellar conflicts. Although his motivations are still unknown, his moniker, "Monster", became a haunting emblem on the battlefield.

content.content: 'Mechs like these aren't too much of a surprise. You send some big, heavy metal out to the outer reaches of the Sphere for somebody to use to dig a hole, and somebody's gonna end up pissed off enough to slap a ton of rockets on it.

content.original: Christina Wolf, known as "Frostmark", was born amidst the icy expanse of her home planet Ryde, a world veiled in perpetual snow and frigid winds. Raised within a secluded outpost on the frozen tundra, she discovered an innate connection with the towering BattleMechs that patrolled the white plains, becoming captivated by their cold steel grace. Embracing her calling, she underwent rigorous training under the watchful eye of a weathered MechWarrior mentor. With a bright blue eye marked by a fierce scar, Christina earned her callsign "Frostmark", a testament to both her icy homeworld and the indomitable spirit etched into her very being. On the battlefield, she is a born leader and can lead a lance through blizzards and low visibility like a guiding beacon, her Mech is like an extension of her soul. Yet, beneath her icey exterior, a glimmer of warmth remains.

content.original: Sargeant Devin Chaste, callsign "Bugaboo" woke up one day in his barracks and realized he had grown weary of leading brash, young mechwarriors to their doom under the uncaring gaze of his commanding officer in the Steiner army. After finally receiving his discharge paperwork for a decorated career in service, he used his connections, along with his pension, to escape into mercenary life. Bugaboo has since proven himself a respectable addition to any mercenary company looking for a lance leader capable of coordinating tactical alpha strikes to the his employer's enemies.

content.original: Dylan Crowther, callsign "Havoc", is a seasoned combatant with decades of experience on the war-torn battlefields of the Inner Sphere. Hailing from a scorched world, he emerged as a formidable MechWarrior shaped by numerous conflicts. Widely regarded for his unmatched prowess and tactical brilliance, "Endgame" has earned a reputation as a living legend among mercenaries and a haunting specter among adversaries.

content.content: "Crime doesn't pay, Teo Navarro," said his mama. "You just keep your head down and work hard and be glad we're in the Federated Suns and not in any of those other places." Crime doesn't pay… except when it does. Crime paid for his mama's heart surgery and his little sisters' schooling. Crime put food on the table when Mama couldn't get enough work and basic benefits were cut once again so the military could build yet more war machines. Crime does pay…. until you get caught. And even then, the House Davion military industrial complex wanted to recruit him, not punish him. That was what the Third Succession War had driven proud House Davion to. He wanted to spit in their faces and accept the execution they offered him as an alternative. But would the criminal organization continue to take care of his family if he died for them? Sometimes they did, and sometimes they didn't. Best, he decided, to appear to die. To do what the Federated Suns asked him to do. So he did, for a while. He tracked and brokered and assassinated. Until Mama died anyhow, at the bottom of an endless waiting list for another surgery. He walked away that night, collected his two youngest sisters and his orphaned nieces, and took them all out to the Periphery, away from the corrupt, treacherous Inner Sphere. Now, they live someplace safe. He still sends them most of the money he makes as a mercenary, and his kit is covered in photos of his family. The older ones are somber, but the younger ones smile. Mama would, finally, be proud

content.original: Elle Swanson, callsign "Hydra" is a young MechWarrior recognized for her exceptional versatility and prowess on the battlefield. Raised in a military family, she inherited a legacy of valor and dedication to the Inner Sphere. From an early age, she demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for piloting BattleMechs and quickly rose through the ranks. As "Hydra", her strategic ingenuity makes her a formidable opponent, capable of seamlessly transitioning between offensive and defensive roles.

content.content:
"Djandoubi" is said to have been the last Guillotine 3N created at the Newhart Industries factory on New Earth before its destruction in 2776 during the Amaris Civil War. While that factoid is practically impossible to prove, it hasn't stopped this particular unit from receiving a lot of special attention from MechTechs eager to make their mark. Or it didn't, until something caused whichever Clan was working on it to abandon it to time. Особенность: Встроенный прожектор Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.16

Лимит приводов рук: Right Lower, Left Upper

content.original: Erin Blight, known by her callsign "Sable", operates within the enigmatic realm of stealth and reconnaissance, her origins remain murky at best but she has showcased an unparalleled skillset in infiltrating enemy lines and extracting vital intelligence. For that reason "Sable" has become a sought-after asset in numerous conflicts across the sector.

content.original: Evan Scrawl, callsign "Hybrid", a skilled MechWarrior with a unique advantage on the battlefield. At the age of 32, he is equipped with custom neural implants that grant him faster reactions and heightened combat prowess. Hailing from a militaristic pirate colony intertwined with the sale of cutting-edge cybernetics, he appears to be a living embodiment of the future of warfare. Through seamless integration of technology and instinct, "Hybrid" moves with a swiftness that at times defies human limitations, often leaving adversaries bewildered by his rapid-fire tactics.

content.content:
"Merchant of Death," "Reaper of Detroit," "Traitor" & "just a typical Capellan." These are all titles that have been used to describe the figure known as "Ruin," "Rapture" & "Teatime." Little concrete information is available about this figure. Even the secret records of the Capellan Confederation offer precious few details other than recording that he is a Capellan citizen.

A deeper dive into some unofficial channels seem to indicate that Teatime was a Maskirovka agent once tasked with advising the Chancellor himself. At some point during this assignment, it seems that Teatime went rogue and used his influence to betray several allies of the Confederation.

Revealed as the root of the betrayal, Teatime was forced to flee, taking on several aliases. Over the course of the next several years, Teatime kept busy by plying the trade routes of Capellan and Canopian space under the guise of a weapons merchant. However, it was eventually found that much of his merchandise was stolen from the Magistracy of Canopus’ own stockpiles and those of the neighbouring Andurien state.

Now hunted by three governments and their agents, Teatime fled to the world of Detroit. On Detroit, forces from all three nations converged to capture the man. However, thanks to years of training, Teatime not only eluded his would be capturers, but turned them against one another. As the three forces battled for who would capture the rogue agent, Teatime unleashed a store of chemical weapons on the planet, decimating its population, along with his hunters. 

Following the Detroit massacre, Teatime disappeared for several more years, eventually surfacing once more, this time at the head of a mercenary band under the employ of the Society during their invasion of the Inner Sphere using the subverted MRBC.

Finally Teatime disappeared altogether, with no confirmed sightings since. Mysteriously, the Capellan records of his crimes and most other documents regarding him vanished at roughly the same time. 

Some unconfirmed theories resound that state that teatime did not actually betray the Confederation at all. Instead they hypothesize he remains a Maskirovka agent, playing out a long and subtle operation. What the aim of this operation is varies from one theory to another, but if any are true, then every citizen in the Sphere should fear what one of the most dangerous Maskirovka agents has in store.

content.original: Grace Turner, aka "Mirage" is a 29-year-old MechWarrior renowned for her mastery of stealth and evasion tactics. She has been known to experiment with holographic decoys and varouse other methods of misdirection. Confounding enemies and leaving an indelible mark on any battle.
content.prevOriginal: Grace Turner, aka "Mirage" is a 29-year-old MechWarrior renowned for her mastery of stealth and evasion tactics. She has been known to experiment with holographic decoys and varouse other methods of misdirection. Confounding enemies and leaving an indelible mark on any battle.
content.content:
"To achieve victory we must make the enemy blind and deaf by sealing his eyes and ears."

Raised on the Periphery world of Fronc, Sam spent many years serving as infantry in the Colonial Marshals defending colonists from pirates. When his promotion finally went through he was shipped off to the Institute of War in Canopus for Mechwarrior training where he specialized in signals warfare and developed a fascination with cat ears.

Sam's time in the Institute was cut short however, when the news reported that back home a group of Colonial Marshals had taken hostages and demanded independence for the colonies. Rather than wait to see if he'd be declared guilty by association, Sam took the first jump ship out of system and struck out on his own, offering his skills to mercenary outfits throughout the Periphery.

content.original: Haru Nakamura, callsign "Hipfire", a seasoned 33-year-old MechWarrior with a storied past as an ex-pirate. Once part of a pirate organisation "The Bloody Hands", he has since turned his back on his criminal roots, seeking redemption and a new path on the battlefield. Renowned for his lethal accuracy and lightning-fast reflexes, "Hipfire" specializes in weapons systems, delivering precise and devastating barrages upon his enemies.

content.original: Henry Ortega, callsign "Endgame", a well respected tactical mastermind with a turbulent past. Once a cunning and ruthless marauder, he eventually severed ties with his lawless origins when his daughter Brodie was born. Renowned for his strategic brilliance, he calculates every move on the battlefield, transforming each encounter into a decisive endgame.

content.original: Igor Teschan is an interesting case. Rumor is he was betrayed by a member of his pirate crew on the surface of Senorbi. He never talks about the incident but the the rumor is bad enough. Apparently a pirate mechwarrior who goes by the callsign "Matador" blindsided him with a ferocious alpha strike from a tricked out firestarter. Igor was unable to eject due to his pre sabotaged eject system. These days Igor is rarely seen out of his Neurosynaptic Interface Suit (NSI). he is heavily scarred and his eyes have been replaced with cybernetics giving them a cold red glow. Now he spends his days with a laser focus, sharpening his Mechwarrior skills in the hope that one day he might run into an old friend...

content.original: Background: James Fairchild, bearing the callsign "Hunter", is a 27-year-old MechWarrior of significant means and skill. Born into wealth and privilege, he chose to follow a unique path as a formidable bounty hunter. Gifted with abundant resources, he outfits his Mechs with state-of-the-art equipment and weaponry, making him a formidable force on any contract. Despite his privileged background, "Hunter" remains down-to-earth, committed to delivering swift justice and claiming bounties that challenge even the most skilled adversaries.

Despite her privileged background, she is admired by her peers for her humility and sense of justice.

content.original: Janet frost was born into a family of pirates, her own ideals however drew her away from the pirate life. She now serves as a highly skilled mercinary mechwarrior. Her callsign, "Helix", is reference to her pilot liniage, to remind her that despite her families choices, she is free to live by her own moral code.

content.original: Jenny Ospring, callsign "Lighter" was named for her peculiarly grim-toned catchphrase on her leopard rides home "... Anyone got a light?". Known throughout the periphery as a calculated, contract killer that never leaves a mark breathing past her employer's initial deposit for work. She is often under the employ of both local governments and savvy commanders as no one can argue with the results, especially from those who can afford her services.

content.original: John Loft, callsign "Midnight", is a 35-year-old MechWarrior renowned for his methodical approach and unparalleled dedication to study and preparation. Hailing from a family of military strategists, he inherited a legacy of tactical brilliance and meticulous planning. The callsign comes from him staying up late to meticulously analyze enemy patterns and weaknesses, devising intricate battle strategies to ensure victory.

content.original: Raised at a mercinary stronghold on Cassia Julia grew up surrounded by Battlemechs with her sister Amanda.  They were both later trained at the renowned Blackstar Academy, becoming highly skilled MechWarriors.  Julia's elegant finesse and innate protective nature earned her the moniker "Angel".  While her sisters firey nature and daring approach earned her the callsign "Firefly".  A falling out over the morality of a complex mission caused the sisters to go their seperate ways. However, they still hold an unbreakable bond, maybe one day they will be reconcile.

content.original: Kelly Masters, callsign "Dream", is an extraordinary MechWarrior with an unprecedented story. A former scientist at an experimental weapons facility, she faced a life-altering accident that changed the course of her existence. During an ill-fated experiment, she was exposed to a potent energy source, leaving her trapped in a glowing blue energy form that defies comprehension. Forced to rely on a specialized containment suit to survive, Kelly now lives as a living entity of raw energy, forgoing the need for sleep or sustenance. After the catastrophic event, the unscrupulous corporation she worked for sought to exploit her newfound abilities. Confined within their research facility, Kelly endured years of captivity, her life reduced to endless experiments and observation. However, fate smiled upon her when a mercenary company of MechWarriors attacked the facility, seeking to disrupt the corporation's sinister schemes. In the chaos of battle, Kelly saw a glimmer of hope and seized the opportunity to break free from her captivity. The mercenaries, astonished by her extraordinary powers, offered her a chance for a new life among them.

content.original: Kel Snowborn aka "Gunrunner" is an ex bounty hunter from the mercenary group DDI. After a shady deal went bad he was forced into hiding and left the spacer life. Three years later Kel remerged as a MechWarrior running a small operation of mercs. Aggressive and intelligent, Kel seems to have a gift in his ability to adapt quickly to any tactical situation and is a dangerous asset to any Lance.

content.original: Mr. Lee Williams, best known by his, callsign "Rustler" is used to hunting down the snakes that dared to desert Capellan armies. The Confederacy suffers no cowards and none live that openly concede to betraying such an allegiance, lest they feel the stinging snake bite of one of Lee's poisoned skinning knives.  His unwavering allegiance once he commits to a job has had a considerable effect on those willing to put him on a payroll, as he will pursue fleeing Mechwarriors until they are nothing more than a smoldering ruin on the Battlefield. He slices verticle lines on portions of his body with scars denoting his victims, past, present and future.

content.original: Liam Foster, known by the callsign "Tesla", is a 33-year-old prodigious MechWarrior, celebrated for his unparalleled engineering brilliance. From an early age, Liam's fascination with mechanics and technology was evident, earning him the nickname "Tesla" after the famed inventor. Raised in a family of skilled engineers, he honed his skills alongside his kin, becoming a master of mech modifications and innovations. Tesla fights with technical prowess on the battlefield, optimizing his BattleMech's performance and tailoring custom upgrades. His profound understanding of systems grants him a distinct advantage, making him an invaluable asset to his mercenary unit.

content.original: Lilly Stewart, known as "Deadlock", is a 36-year-old MechWarrior recognized for her unwavering determination and exceptional close-quarters combat skills. With a steady hand and a fierce resolve, she excels in confined spaces and urban landscapes, and has countless successful drops to her name. Lilly Stewart has already left an indelible mark on the Inner Sphere.

content.original: Logan Blake, callsign "Hightail", is a skilled MechWarrior with a compelling history. Once a highly decorated officer in a Steiner Spec ops unit, he now roams as a seasoned mercenary, seeking fortune and adventure on the frontlines. Famed for his speed and agility on the battlefield and a preference for lighter mechs, Logan earned his callsign "Hightail" through his reputation for quick thinking and precise maneuvers, he excels in hit-and-run tactics, always staying a step ahead of the opposition. As a former commander, he brings strategic expertise to his mercenary unit, proving to be a valuable asset to any contract.
