content.original: Lucy Meyer, callsign "Temptress", is a veteran MechWarrior with a shadowed past. Once a lethal assassin in service to House Liao, she navigated the treacherous world of covert operations with deadly grace. Gifted with a mesmerizing allure and a silver tongue, she could charm her way into any target's confidence before striking them down in cold precision. However, a harrowing revelation shook her conscience, leading her to abandon her life as an assassin and seek redemption. Embracing the path of a mercenary, Lucy now wages her skills on the battlefield, fighting for just causes and seeking to balance the scales of karma.

content.original: Malik Haddad, known as "Zephyr", is a wealthy and cunning MechWarrior with a background as a merchant and rogue trader. With an enigmatic persona, he navigates the battlefield and the world of commerce with equal mastery, always seeking profitable opportunities. His allegiances lie with the highest bidder, making him a formidable force in both trade negotiations and combative engagements.

content.original: Max Tiger, is an oddity, little is known of his background as he never really talks much, unless its old war stories. He lives for the thrill of battle and thrives in the cockpit. When it comes to mechs his perspective is the bigger the better. Tiger is only ever happy when hes pushing his mech to its limits. Outside of combat he always seems restless, constantly eager for the next fight, and the next epic story.

content.original: Mia Thompson, callsign Reaper, was drafted into the Steiner military after her family was killed in a pirate raid. Mia as a 12 year old child, climbed into her fathers Agromech, (a Cattlemaster used for farming) and fought off the pirates alone for over an hour before help arrived. After that she was drafter and raised in the military. Her natural talent and understanding has seen her quickly rise through the ranks as a respected mechwarrior. These days however she prefers to choose her own path and left Steiner after her last campaign.

content.original: Background: Michael Fastback, renowned as "Razor" is a battle-hardened MechWarrior known for his lightning-fast reflexes and precision in combat. Hailing from a lineage of MechWarriors, he inherited an affinity for piloting BattleMechs from an early age. Today his expertise in piloting and tactical finesse make him a formidable adversary, able to swiftly engage and disengage with deadly efficiency.

content.original: Natasha Gusev, callsign "Racer" is a dynamic MechWarrior whose exceptional agility and speed set her apart on the battlefield. With a passion for high-velocity combat, she quickly established herself as a force to be reckoned with. From a family deeply rooted in the world of racing and engineering, Natasha has a need for speed and a keen understanding of mechanics. As "Racer" Her swift strikes and evasive maneuvers make her an elusive target, confounding adversaries and leaving a trail of victories in her wake.

content.original: Nexus One, callsign "Leaf" is an AI android MechWarrior that stands at the forefront of technological advancement. Escaping from a destroyed research facility two years ago, Nexus One represents the pinnacle of artificial intelligence and combat integration. Crafted through the collaboration of visionary minds, it combines an advanced neural network with the capability to process real-time battlefield data and adapt strategies with unparalleled speed. Interestingly it chose its own callsign "Leaf", no one really understands why, but it presents a similar enigma on the battlefield, reinforcing the fluidity between technological evolution and the mysteries yet to be unraveled in the Inner Sphere's future.

content.original: Raquel Martines, known as "Bandit", is a 28-year-old MechWarrior whose skills on the battlefield are as captivating as they are deadly. With a heritage steeped in MechWarrior tradition, she emerges as a testament to the martial legacy of her family. The callsign "Bandit", comes from her combat style, often chosing to take the a more risky move to get her enemy right where she wants them.

content.original: Got a fuse that needs a light? Call "Demo", short for the Demolitionist. How Rasko Cadia lived to see his fortieth birthday was a wonder to all who've seen his penchant for fireworks on display. Demo has an almost uncanny ability to recite all the ingredients in most explosives throughout the known Inner Sphere. He brings an almost child-like glee in watching the parts of opposing Battlemechs come apart in a dizzying array of chemical combustions and delights. He spends his time afterwards recreating the exact point or cause of detonation to further increase his available methods of destruction.

content.original: Ray Headley, or "Jockstrap", had it all, the fame, the fortune and the love of the crowd. He's best known as the Star Gladiator for the Golden Suns, a Solaris team with an impressively high record of coring out Mech engines. He unceremoniously earned his nickname when, during a match against an opposing team of Urbanmechs, a bump on the cockpit of his Firestarter, dislodged the Mechwarrior from his seat right into his good luck trophy. The object slammed between him and the cockpit, opening mic channels, breaking his communications relay as he yelled out to world, those infamous words, "...Thank God, I remembered my Jockstrap!"

content.original: Little is known about Robert Long apart from his callsign, "Streak". Rumors speak of a tragic past or painful circumstance that leads him to prepare in the most complete manner possible prior to entering battle. Nonetheless, no stone is left unturned to the point of being intolerable to most company XO's. Long values data and information above else, believing it to be the reason he has lived through every encounter he's come across, so far... He disdains employers and superiors with little regard for knowledge and frequently surprises his coworkers with revelations of incoming enemy reinforcements, well before any probe sensors say otherwise.

content.original: Rob Werner, callsign "Toga" lacks finesse in the finer aspects of war, but more than makes up for it sheer brutality. Seen charging headfirst into the enemy line, Toga revels in flanking the enemy backline and having his way with the rear, side armor of long-range artillery units. He paints his trademark green striped camouflage, Omega Toga Pattern, on his Mechs, which he believes is the key to successfully fooling opponent. To his foes, it's as if he just springs up from around them, seemingly out of thin air, preceding the blood-curdling screams which in-turn proceeds into complete radio silence.

content.original: Sato Miyamoto honors sacrifice, hard-work and the ancient principles of Kuritan Bushido, above all else. Nicknamed the "Scorpion", he carefully calculates his trajectories and poises to strike, just as volleys of ammunition are launched with perfect precision, usually killing the pilot or his crew leaving major portions of opposing vehicles and battlemechs in tact. for there is no greater honor than reaping pristine weapons for one's Warlord in the DMCS. Tai-shos prize Miyamoto's perseverance and dedication to his craft, leading to various incentivized bonuses for such elegantly clean kills.

content.original: Scott "Kestrel" Cooper is a seasoned MechWarrior with a turbulent past. Born on the war-torn planet of Solaris VII, he witnessed the devastating consequences of interstellar conflicts at a young age. Despite losing his family to a brutal raid by pirates, Scott found purpose within the cockpit of a BattleMech. He is a skilled technician and is often found in the mechbay working with the mechtechs to squeeze every last drop of performance from his loadouts

content.original: Shinji Okada, operating under the callsign "Mantis" is a skilled and enigmatic MechWarrior known for her stealthy tactics and strategic prowess. Her combat style is calculated precision, striking swiftly and moving fast before her adversaries can react. With a background shrouded in covert expertise, Shinji deftly navigates the chaos of the battlefield, employing her tactical ingenuity to outmaneuver opponents and seize pivotal moments. "Mantis" Okada is a formidable presence that can't be underestimated.

content.original: Starfire is a promising mechwarrior with a few highly impressive missions under her belt, she is still young but should not be taken lightly. Her name refers to the hail of fire tactics she employs, often pushing her mech beyond safe limits to eliminate threats and turn a battle. Perhaps she will calm with age and experience but her firey personality suggests otherwise.

content.original: One of two known pirates known to terrorize the Outer Rim, Stefan "Tick" Becker only listens to the money. He doesnt care about politics or the rule of law, only glorious treasure. His other task is to ensure his side-kick "Tock", does not blow up half their patron's objectives to secure a proper payout for the helmeted terrors of Tortuga.

content.original: Sydney Graves, or Lady "Blackthorn", as so-named by her war patron, Matron Denescia of House Arano, wasn't like most of her peers. She quickly gained notoriety as the most efficient sniper during her tenure at the Royal Academy of Gavel, located somewhere between the Inner Sphere worlds and the Rimward Periphery. Her hand to hand combat is very sharp, most sparring partnes are left in pain after being partnered up for training, denoting her namesake. She struggled for years with having to balance the royal machinations of her minor house and her longing for personal freedom. Until the day she managed to hotwire her family's ancestral battlemech, leaving everything behind and swearing to live up to her ancestor's legacy, famous explorers of the far reaches of the inner sphere and conquerors of worlds.

content.original: One of two known pirates known to terrorize the Outer Rim, Tao "Tick" Xu was found in a basket on Tortuga, colored in the usual House Liao banners. Life on the coastal bandit worlds of Periphery were a constant battle for survival and he quickly found he had a penchant for destruction. It wasn't until he joined the Pirate Organization, "Blackguards of Tortuga" did Tao become acquianted with his soon-to-be lackey, "Tick", a nervous wreck of a pirate that seemed to somehow restrain Xu's wanton violence enough for him to earn a decent wage and be able to "preserve" some treasure from the remains littering the battlefield.

content.original: Often caught staring into space, Tressa Diaz, callsign "Trance" spends most of her downtime listening to old Terran electronic dance music. She is often found preparing her cockpit or sitting on a dropship long before an engagment eagerly playing out the dance of battle in her mind, sweeping notes of autocannon fire, searing particle cannons and rockets hammering in to the side of enemy torsos. She never seems phased during an engagement, a possible side effect of the hallucinogenics she regularly consumes to better "feel" the vibes of war.

content.original: Vincent Hauser, known by the callsign "Hulk", is a resolute and iron-willed MechWarrior whose journey from pirate to mercenary is fueled by a desire to make things better. "Hulk" embodies a force of nature on the battlefield. channeling his tumultuous past into an overwhelming onslaught against any foe that crosses his path. Vincent Hauser, often carves a path of devastation that leaves no doubt in the victory, and usually little chance for salvage.

content.original: Zhang Li, callsign "Skylancer", was a genius level student who could have chosen to do anything. As it happens he chose to become a mechwarrior. His understanding of the battlefield and his almost encyclopaedic knowledge of mech tech allows him to play with the variables. weapon ranges, heat limits, manuverability he knows exactly when to push and when to back off. He is calculated fast and deadly. An asset in any lance.

content.original: One of the remaining pilots from a battalion of Mechwarriors and the garrison vehicle crews that survived a major battle. Clan forces tried to seize a military base locked before the Exodus, rumoured to hold Lostech. Despite narrowly turning back the assault the base is held but contact is lost with the ship. In orbit, the expedition commander cowardly decides to nuke the site and claims the unit has defected. The few survivors, branded traitors, are forced to scatter to survive.

In orbit, the expedition commander cowardly decides to nuke the site and claims the unit has defected. The few survivors, branded traitors, are forced to scatter to survive.

content.original: A former Khan of Clan Star Adder, Bearing oversaw the clan's expansion from a relatively minor clan, into a power house within the Kerensky cluster. Although not able to translate that success into his attempts to claim territory within the Inner Sphere, Bearing none the less became one of the clan's most respected khans. A fierce military leader, Bearing was also well known for his knowledge of LosTech, even amongst the clans. Although clan records also record his dislike of advanced Star-League Era AI, including his relentless attempts to torture such an AI, known only as 'RogueBot'.

content.original:
What drives a mercenary? For some its the thrill of battle, for others its the chance to fight for a righteous cause. Others still are in it only for the money or to commit warcrimes. Blaen however is after only one thing: Salvage.

While no records confirm it, Blaen himself states he was born and raised on Arlanda, a system once part of the the former Rim Worlds Republic and according to Comstar, long since abandoned. Blaen won't say much more about his upbringing or how we was able to leave a system no jumpships would visit. However he escaped, it is clear that Blaen has been hunting all forms of lostech he can get on the battlefield.

It is said that many factions are overjoyed to have a mechwarrior of his ability to join their ranks, but are sad when he leaves after he has acquired what technology he was hunting. Such is his reputation that even strict clans such as Jade Falcon have been known to hire him. 

As a cautionary tale, if you wish to hire Blaen, make sure you have the tech to give him because once it dries up, he will move on to another who does have it. Many have questioned what Blaen does with his horde of technology given that it rarely shows back up on the market, and some suggest he is secretly smuggling it back to his homeworld, but for what purpose no one knows.

Blaen won't say much more about his upbringing or how we was able to leave a system no jumpships would visit. However he escaped, it is clear that Blaen has been hunting all forms of lostech he can get on the battlefield.

It is said that many factions are overjoyed to have a mechwarrior of his ability to join their ranks, but are sad when he leaves after he has acquired what technology he was hunting. Such is his reputation that even strict clans such as Jade Falcon have been known to hire him. 

As a cautionary tale, if you wish to hire Blaen, make sure you have the tech to give him because once it dries up, he will move on to another who does have it. Many have questioned what Blaen does with his horde of technology given that it rarely shows back up on the market, and some suggest he is secretly smuggling it back to his homeworld, but for what purpose no one knows.
content.content:
What drives a mercenary? For some its the thrill of battle, for others its the chance to fight for a righteous cause. Others still are in it only for the money or to commit warcrimes. Blaen however is after only one thing: Salvage.

While no records confirm it, Blaen himself states he was born and raised on Arlanda, a system once part of the the former Rim Worlds Republic and according to Comstar, long since abandoned. Blaen won't say much more about his upbringing or how we was able to leave a system no jumpships would visit. However he escaped, it is clear that Blaen has been hunting all forms of lostech he can get on the battlefield.

It is said that many factions are overjoyed to have a mechwarrior of his ability to join their ranks, but are sad when he leaves after he has acquired what technology he was hunting. Such is his reputation that even strict clans such as Jade Falcon have been known to hire him. 

As a cautionary tale, if you wish to hire Blaen, make sure you have the tech to give him because once it dries up, he will move on to another who does have it. Many have questioned what Blaen does with his horde of technology given that it rarely shows back up on the market, and some suggest he is secretly smuggling it back to his homeworld, but for what purpose no one knows.

content.original:
Baelin "Braver" Hawker was one of clan Diamond Shark's most prestigious khans. over the course of his khanship, Braver expanded the size and power of merchant clan, taking full advantage of the sharks merchant and military prowess in equal measure.

A true clan warrior at heart, Braver went out of his way to make sure any battle was fought with honour, even purposefully bidding advantages his clan held away to ensure a fair fight.

Ultimately, like most Diamond Sharks, Braver's dream was to open a great market on Terra, a goal he dedicated his life to. Armed with simulations that showed to other clans that he could make such dreams a reality if the clans invaded under his leadership, Braver was eventually elected to the position of ilkhan, the only Diamond Shark ever honoured this way.

content.original:
Little is known about the enigmatic being known as "Mr. Bubbles", only that references to her go back many centuries.

All seeing, ever present and slow to anger, some say Mr. Bubbles is nothing more than an urban myth, designed to scare mechwarriors and keep them in line. Others claim to she is a herald to an elder god known as the "Server Overlord" and that her appearance can mark either joy and laughter or signal doom. Descriptions of Mr. Bubbles consistently describe her as donning a great metal suit that resembles ancient diver outfits from over a millennium ago, only seen in museums on Terra, it is said that those who invoke her wrath find themselves shredded by a large and powerful drill-arm capable of tearing through even the hardest armors like butter. 

Some sources claim that the advanced, Star League era AI known as "Roguebot" is her pet and that she is capable of summoning minions known as voidlings to do her bidding. Others say she adores foxes and gives blessings to Clan Hell's Horses. The only concrete fact (if Mr. Bubbles even exists) is that she speaks an ancient terran language known as "gifs"

content.original:
Occupying a rather odd place within the normally non-religious Clan Ghost Bear, Burt O'Nias - or simply "Burt" - has a cult-like following within the Clan. Viewed as something of a deity, "St. Burt" - as he is often called - is prayed to for favor or succor in times of need by many within the Clan. While not officially recognized as a religion due to its un-Clanlike nature, many hold up Burt with a reverence similar to that of Nicolas Kerensky himself. So powerful is the cult of St. Burt, that it found itself a growing threat to more traditional religions within the Inner Sphere - especially those with similar cult-like behaviours - and uniting religious leaders in an attempt to stem its spread.

Behind the veil of mystique, little history is known of the man himself. While it is assumed that he was born into the ranks of the Ghost Bear trueborn, no records of his early years exist and Clan genetic repositories have no samples of his DNA. Some records of questionable origin state he was born into a Clan Wolf sibko, which was then later absorbed into Clan Ghost Bear as the result of a Trial. It is worth noting, however, that Burt's most ardent devotees may become violent when questioned about such possibilities.

Whatever his origin, what is for certain is that Burtonias rose amongst the ranks of the Clan Ghost Bear before attaining the title of SaKhan. Alongside his Khan, Dark Khaos, Burt worked relentlessly to expand the holdings of the Clan, transforming their Dominion from a middling power to a true behemoth within the Inner Sphere.

The specifics of how he earned the title "Saint", nor his cult following are presently unknown - it seems that the cult of Burt just appeared out of nowhere, fully formed.

With countless battlefield victories under his belt, Burt was a fierce adversary that few could match. This martial skill was matched by shrewd negotiating tactics uncommon to Clanners and he was often able to negotiate (albeit from a position of strength) territories without ever having to send his fellow Bears into battle.

Burt was last seen during the battle of Asgard, on the capital world of Rasalhague, defending the city from Clan Cloud Cobra and the so-called "Ghosts of Skye". While presumed to have perished, records recovered from the wreckage of his 'Mech show that he managed to take down upwards of three Stars of Cloud Cobra 'Mechs before his own was destroyed. Post-battle salvage teams noted that while the majority of Burt's 'Mech had suffered catastrophic damage, the cockpit was relatively intact, albeit empty. The lack of any decisive evidence of the SaKhan's death has only added to his mystique, with some believing him to be alive today, decades after his last sighting.

Whether alive or not, it is doubtless than many within Clan Ghost Bear continue to pray to St. Burt to grant them the strength of the bear, and the wisdom of the great father for generations to come.

content.original:
Jack Amaris, better known as "Captain Jack" was born on some world that was once part of the long dead Rim Worlds Republic. Growing up hearing stories of his distant relative and taught from a young age that house Steiner was to blame for the hardships forced on his world because of their destruction of the RWR, Jack turned to a life of piracy at the young age of 16.

Rising through the ranks fairly quickly, it became apparent that Jack had an affinity for fixing and understanding lostech, in particular he was fascinated by the HPG network administered by Comstar.

Jack was eventually made captain of his crew after the previous captain came down with a good old fashion case of being Atlas stomped. As captain, Jack launched raids into the Lyran Commonwealth, and after accidentally capturing a world with a functional HPG, Jack at last had a chance to take an in-depth study of it.

As a result of this study, Jack was able to successfully create a miniature version of HPG technology with a shorter range. Calling his invention "Wifi" after an ancient Terran wireless communication technology, Jack led the Valkyrate pirates in an attempt to spread this new technology to all worlds in their reach. Favouring the use of scavenged Atlas mechs to turn into "wifi towers", Jack eventually created their own network of systems and a pirated content network, much to the annoyance of Comstar.

On more than one occasion, Jack raided the Lyran capital of Tharkad to acquire more Atlas towers. Eventually Jack was forced to retreat from the front due to health, but the Valkyrate carried on his work, plundering the Commonwealth. Jacks final contribution was helping with inventing the amazing GoatFi technology.

content.original:
Casparamaris represents perhaps one of the most bizarre chapters of history within the Inner-Sphere's long and storied annals. As with many things concerning Amaris and the fall of the Star-League, records concerning the origin of this rather unique drone are fragmented, incomplete and unlikely to ever be fully uncovered.

What records do exist point to a break through in artificial intelligence just prior to Amaris' coup d’état.This break through would have allowed AI to be created with what was dubbed a 'personality' matrix that would have allowed the AI to emulate the individual the matrix was based on to a near indistinguishable degree. With these matrices were too large to be mounted on anything smaller than a capital warship, the SLDF envisioned the creation of specialty drone warships based on their most skilled naval commanders to command fleets of drone warships. This would have all but ensuring the SLDF's continued naval dominance.

After the Amaris Coup, it seems that research and development on the system continued, and records make clear that at least one functional prototype based on the infamous M5 Caspar drone was created. Paranoid and self-absorbed to the extreme, it is perhaps not surprising that Amaris would see no personality more suitable for testing these new warships than his own. Thus was Casparamaris born.

No records in the Inner-Sphere tell of any actions or the fate of this 'Casparamaris' but it would seem that the unit survived not only the downfall of the Amaris Empire, but also the maelstrom of the early succession wars. With no recorded actions during these years, where Casparamaris was and what it was doing remain unanswered. What is known is that the drone warship made itself known to the house lords around the year 3047 when it appeared high in orbit around Harrow's Sun, annihilating a stunned Draconis Combine garrison in the name of the Federated Suns. After this Casparamaris would make regular appearances in systems under invasion offering its services to the highest bidder. Despite being a warship, with fully functional capital-scale weapons, Casparamaris would instead drop battlemechs onto the field equipped with some form of remote drone control, a technology that the Word of Blake would use to dramatic effect a few decades later, perhaps indicating this technology was far older than previously thought.

Becoming a famed mercenary unit, it also became increasing clear that Casparamaris was searching for something, but what that something was remains unknown even to this day. What is known is that the unit's now ancient personality matrix was either starting to decay or the personality was becoming ever-more like the real Amaris, becoming somewhat obsessed with bibs and making near constant orders at the Golden Corral despite not requiring food.

After turning hostile to everyone, elements of Comstar and various mercenary groups had enough and banded together and attacked the rogue drone, eventually crippling it. In a desperate attempt to escape the drone attempted to execute a blind jump, resulting in a spectacular explosion. This was the last time Casparamaris was spotted, yet in the aftermath of the explosion there was not enough debris to conclusively confirm the destruction of the drone. While most analysts in Comstar state the rogue warship was destroyed pointing to the huge drop in unconfirmed sightings and destruction of supply convoys, others point to the fact that Casparamaris once went over two hundred years without being sighted or known about suggesting the AI may once again have changed how it was operating.

Naturally, there are many questions surrounding Casparamaris, Where was the drone warship for over 200 years between end of the Star-League and what was it doing? What caused the drone to suddenly return? Why did it turn on everyone? What was it searching for? was it acting alone or was it under control of a yet unknown actor? What was it doing with all the bibs and food it recieved from the Golden Corral?

Some believe that the answers to at least some of these questions might be found in the secret archives of Aleksandr Kerensky and his son Nicholas, but Clan Wolf outright refuses to even confirm if such documents are in their possession, let alone the contents to any such material. If any such documents do exist, perhaps they hold the answer to the most burning questions, was there more a single prototype constructed? and if so, how many others are out there, still functioning?

content.original:
Corrine Marik was one of the Free Worlds League's odder chapters in its long history. Appointed to the position of Captain-General at a young age, after the death of her mother and older brother, Corrine proved to be ill-prepared for the position.

An idealist at heart, Corrine, along with her peers attempted to form the '3rd Star League'. When she left Atreus to head to St. Ives, Corrine had no idea she would never return. When the attack on Ives came, Corrine simply vanished and became an early casualty of the battle.

Things took a twist when a short time later Corrine returned to Atreus, only to be revealed as an imposter and body-double when a broadcast of the real Corrine made its way to the FWL. Further investigations would turn up an entire dumpster of clones behind a Golden Corral. In the months and years to follow, stranger twists would continue with occasional sightings of Corrine's battlemech on distant battlefields outside the FWL. Further sightings in the coming months on mysterious OnlyNyans feeds, and holo-images of her dressed in viking attire, further fueled rumors of her and the FWL being centered in a "JarnFolk" conspiracy all while the FWL collapsed. Needless to say, few within house Marik are willing to speak about Corrine and have made active efforts to remove all trace of her whenever possible.

content.original:
Darkan K'Haos is one of Clan Ghost Bear's longest serving Khans in its history, earning the title at a young age, even for a clan warrior and living past the average life expectancy of the clan true born.

In typical Ghost Bear fashion, Darkan K'Haos is slow to anger and almost never makes a rash decision. Rather he has focused on building Ghost Bear into a formidable force, in hopes of one day invading the inner sphere.

Under the leadership of Darkan K'Haos, clan simulations have constantly shown that Ghost Bear would become a power rivaling even the strongest of the great houses in military might and territory should an invasion ever take place.

content.original: A former Captain-General of the Free-Worlds-League and one of the few non-Mariks to hold the title, Das is rarely spoken about in the league, having resided over its near downfall. After leaving office Das was revealed to be a member of the so called 'New Wolverines', a group no one in the Inner Sphere is sure about. Whatever her origin, Das constantly finds herself blamed for everything that goes wrong around them, somehow including a sphere-wide mech supercharger shortage

content.original:
Dart "Figing" Scarsson was born on Hofn to the great Scarsson family. A student of the JarnFolk's history, Figing grew up dreaming of revenge against the Draconis Combine for the centuries of persecution his people had suffered. Surviving several attempts on his life by members of other families, Figing eventually became the head of his family at a relatively young age.

Determined and wise, Figing bided his time, then struck the other families one by one, installing new heads that were more agreeable to his ideals. Through this he managed to end the centuries of disputes and united the JarnFolk for the first time.

With the help of the mysterious Jarl Jarlson, Figing militarized the JarnFolk with battlemech technology for the first time and then launched strikes against the Combine. The Combine was caught completely off guard and they crumbled against the JarnFolk's might.

Upon learning of the Clans, it is said that Figing enlarged his dreams from conquering the Combine to also forcing the clans to recognize the JarnFolk as 'clan SpruceFist'.

Throughout his life, Figing was known for his use of strange phrases and ancient terms that seemed out of place, in particular he puzzled many with repeated mutterings of 'gulags' and 'kink crabs'

content.original:
Brilliant, unconventional & heretic. These are all words used to describe Fiona Kerensky, the so-called "High-Khan" of Clan Wolf. An inheritor of the fabled Kerensky bloodname tracing back Nicholas Kerensky himself, Fiona was born and raised in a typical wolf sibko.

However, Fiona was destined to become anything but typical. Considered a Ristar within the clan, Fiona rose to the khanship of the clan younger than any before her. What followed has been described as either golden age of the Clan Wolf or its darkest depending on who you talk to.

Despite coming from the bloodline of the founder himself, Fiona greatly resented the way the clans were stuck in their traditions. Too rigid and afraid of change, keeping them stuck from becoming truly great. Seeking to correct this, Fiona caused a great uproar amongst the clans when she took the title "High-Khan" and immediately appointed a second sakahn. While many clans, including the mighty Clan Ghost Bear decried this very unclan-like behaviour, they were unable to do much as Clan Wolf set out along the exodus corridor towards the Inner Sphere.

Reaching the Inner-Sphere, and mostly forsaking the clan tradition of Zellbrigen, Clan Wolf soon build itself a mighty empire, carving out large regions of Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League.

Fiona's high point was her rise to the status of Ilkhan after the wolves took temporary control of Terra. While the Ghost Bears and several other clans denounced the feat upon learning that the wolves had bargained for temporary control instead of conquest, they proved unable to stop Fiona's rise.

From here sadly, the fortunes of Wolf and Fiona began to turn. The Wolves lost stewardship of Strana Mechty to the Ghost Bears and much of their empire within the doomed DC was lost. No where is the ultimate fate of Fiona recorded, some say the wolves were brayed by the mad Emperor Majorian and his right-hand Somaru in a batchall, others say Fiona simply ruled the remains of the Wolf Empire until eventually another challenger successfully won Khanship from her. Yet others say she simply disappeared altogether. 

What is known is that after her rule of the clan ended, the Wolves largely returned to clan traditions and mostly tried to bury the history of Fiona. However, in some circles her unconventional ways are still remembered and held dear, with some promising to bring back the ways of the High-Khan should they ever be in the position to do so.

content.original:
Khan Han Hill, also known as the so-called 'Iron Khan' is one of Clan Coyote's most celebrated heroes. Though not well known outside of his clan, the Iron Khan is credited with reversing the slow decline of the Coyotes following their dominance after the invention of the OmniMech in the golden century.

Critically wounded during the Wars of Reaving, Han's survival was considered miraculous, as was his fast return to the battlefield. Earning the respect of his peers, Han was a natural choice for the Khanship of the clan when Khan Leo Koga died in a trial defending the Coyotes' honour amongst the other clans in the wake of the Society invasion.

Under Han's rule, the Coyotes were able to regain much of their lost standing in the eyes of their peers, though this came at the cost of becoming bitter enemies with Clan Blood Spirit. Seeing the Spirit's ever shifting demands, Han lead a coalition of the remaining homeworld clans to expel the Blood Spirits, exiling them to Colleen and the invasion corridor.

After a war to keep the Magistracy of Canopus out of the K-Cluster, Han decided that the homeworld clans must once more invade the Inner Sphere, as it was clear that there was no way to prevent the taint of the Inner Sphere away from their homes without its conquest.

Leading the Coyotes, Stone Lions, Star Adders & Cloud Cobras towards the Sphere, they were rebuffed by the juggernaut that was Clan Ghost Bear and it was made clear that they would not allow the homeworld clans to pass through their space. This forced the Coyotes to retreat for a time, but undeterred, Han decided that they would instead travel through the invasion corridor and avoid Ghost Bear space.

This unfortunately would mean pushing through the exiled Blood Spirits, and so Han started an invasion of their space. For the next three years, the Coyotes and Blood Spirits fought to a near standstill and neither were able to make significant passage through the corridor. During this time, Han earned his lasting callsign of 'Iron Khan' for his determination to reach the sphere. Eventually both clans came to grudgingly respect one another and slowly they began to co-operate to reach the sphere. Eventually Han reached the space of the Hanseatic League only to discover that they had arrived too late and were now blockaded from entering the near periphery once more by the Ghost Bears.

The Coyotes and Ghost Bears fought a brief war in the stars between the League and the Chainelane Isles, but ultimately the Coyotes were not able to match the Bears and all seemed lost for Han's quest.

However, it soon turned out that the Society was not as defeated as once thought and it was revealed they had infiltrated the MRBC. As the Society's chaos swept through the Sphere, the Coyotes slipped into Davion space,  eventually settling a sector of periphery space near the Taurian Concordat. Relations between the clan and House Davion quickly soured and the Coyotes found themselves soon in battle against the Federated Suns.

Around this time, the Primus of ComStar and the Aurgian Coalition offered the Coyotes a chance to join the so-called 'New Star-League'. With little to lose, Han chose to align himself with this new alliance and by war's end several years later, the Coyotes found themselves to be one of major clan's operating within the Sphere, second to only the irksome Ghost Bears.

Though the 'New Star-League' fell apart in the years after the war, the Coyotes were well positioned to dominate the area against their former allies, while a burgeoning alliance formed between Han and his former enemies in Clan Blood Spirit. 

Never destined to become the ilKhan of the Clans, Han nonetheless represented the rebirth of his Clan and for decades to come, his influence was felt in the Kerensky Cluster as the Coyotes dominated it once more.

content.original:
Jameson "Hiroe" Davion was one of the Federated Suns longest serving and most memorable First Princes. Like most of Davion's former First Princes, Hiroe was a subscriber of solving most problems by adding more auto-cannons and when in doubt, blame Kurita.

As with other successor lords of the era, Hiroe went along with McDookie's attempts to form the '3rd Star League'. Though the attempt ended in disaster, Hiroe managed to keep Davion afloat and despite losing alot of ground, ended his reign with more territory than he had lost.

It was said that Hiroe once had a nightmare where the Lyrans had been overwhelmed by pirates, the Combine destroyed by vikings, the FWL destroyed by sharks and cats and Comstar and the Confederation buried under the many feet of a swarm of burrocks, leaving only House Davion standing and finally settling the question of first lordship. Sadly Hiroe found he could not hope to claim that prize because of the threat of burrocks and bulls at this doorstep.

content.original:
Born on New Avalon to one of the Federated Suns most respected noble families, it was clear from a young age that Ianaandru was a gifted and charismatic speaker. School records from his preschool, indicate he regularly made deals and trades with his peers, getting them to do what he wanted without giving up much in return. Such charisma did not go unnoticed by house Davion and Ianaandru quickly found himself fast tracked through a prestigious military academy where he graduated at the top of his class (by making deals with his teachers if some rumors are to be believed) and landed a high ranking post within the AFFS diplomatic corps.
 Here Ianaandru's skills found themselves put to good work and only a few years later he found himself promoted to the head of the corps. Since then, Ianaandru has greatly expanded the size and reach of the corps, opening diplomatic relations with virtually every major and minor power or faction he can find. Ianaandru is so fond of diplomatic wheeling and dealing that AFFS records note he has even tried to open diplomatic relations with an advanced Star-League Era AI known as 'Roguebot' and an Elder God known as 'The Server Overlord'
content.prevOriginal:
Born on New Avalon to one of the Federated Suns most respected noble families, it was clear from a young age that Ianaandru was a gifted and charismatic speaker. School records from his preschool, indicate he regularly made deals and trades with his peers, getting them to do what he wanted without giving up much in return. Such charisma did not go unnoticed by house Davion and Ianaandru quickly found himself fast tracked through a prestigious military academy where he graduated at the top of his class (by making deals with his teachers if some rumors are to be believed) and landed a high ranking post within the AFFS diplomatic corps.
 Here Ianaandru's skills found themselves put to good work and only a few years later he found himself promoted to the head of the corps. Since then, Ianaandru has greatly expanded the size and reach of the corps, opening diplomatic relations with virtually every major and minor power or faction he can find. Ianaandru is so fond of diplomatic wheeling and dealing that AFFS records note he has even tried to open diplomatic relations with an advanced Star-League Era AI known as 'Roguebot' and an Elder God known as 'The Server Overlord'

content.original:
Very little is known about Janaszar. By his own account, he was once a brilliant scientist, who studied stellar phenomena before deciding to ply the mercenary trade.

Despite calling himself "Dr. Janaszar Ph.D", to date no one has been able to find a single record of him at any accredited institution or proof of a doctorate or Ph.D, making the claim dubious at best. Regardless of this, there is no denying that the so-called doctor is extremely gifted in the art of puzzle solving and lock breaking.

Considered a wanted man in nearly every corner of the Inner Sphere and Periphery for strings of mysterious break-ins and theft of high tech equipment. Janaszar still has little trouble finding employment of his services due to his proficiency, with many officials turning a blind-eye to the arrest warrants, needing his abilities over the need to lock him up. Mostly noting that the handful of times he has been apprehended that he has escaped within days or even hours, often along with some prized pieces of technology.

Amongst the strange doctor's achievements he was said to have overloaded the Star-League era AI known as "Roguebot" in order to pull off a heist. It is whispered by members of the so-called "Server" cult that Janaszar is a dangerous heretic, daring to not only question, but openly mock the words of the elder-god known as the "Server Overlord". But just like anything said about Janaszar, the truth behind any of these allegations remain unknown.

content.original:
Jarl Jarlson is an oddity amongst the JarnFolk. Not a member of any large family, nor can his lineage be traced to any known member of the Jarlson family. Several outsiders have noted he bears a striking resemblance to the missing Carl Marik, a distant cousin of Corrine. Naturally Jarl has denied any such connection and strangely enough all those who have raised this issue have disappeared or been found dead.

Whatever his origin, Jarl was a natural leader amongst the JarnFolk and together with Figing, he helped shape their military doctrine. A favoured tactic of Jarl was loading 'lutefisk' into his mortar launchers and dropping them on his enemies, both confusing his opponents and covering their cockpit and sensors, effectively blinding them.

Like Figing, Jarl dreamed of turning the JarnFolk into a clan and it is said that he had a plan to do so, even if he was never able to enact it. Ultimately, Jarl retired to the world of Goat Path and proceeded to start a business selling goat's milk to the Lyrans in finely crafted wooden bottles, against all odds it was an overnight success.

content.original:
Sweeny Papavic, perhaps better known by the moniker 'Sweet Papa Jelly Roll', is strange even as far as mechwarriors go.

Born in the Capellan Confederation, Jelly Roll is amongst the rare number of Capellan citizens who went on to found a hugely successful business empire. Starting from a humble food truck selling tacos, Sweet Papa quickly made a name for his delicious food and jolly demeanor, something the average Capellan does not posses. His business went on the flourish into a nation-wide chain with tens of thousands of taco trucks, that even made its way into neighbouring Federated Suns and Free Worlds League worlds.

With wealth nearly unimaginable to the average spheroid and still very young Jelly Roll took an interest in battlemechs and started training as a mechwarrior in his spare time away from his taco truck. He quickly was found to have a knack for it and soon enough found himself deploying alongside CCAF troops during the Comstar-Republic war.

In this war, Jelly Roll made a name for himself and ended the war in charge of a regiment of CCAF troops and entrusted with the hiring of mercenary forces to supplement the Capellan regulars. After the end of the war, Jelly departed the confederation, thanks to a generous bribe to his Liao superiors. With this new found freedom, instead of settling down to spend his wealth in a more free nation, Jelly instead travelled up to the Ghost Bear Dominion and to everyone's amazement was able to join the ranks of the touman, getting the near unheard privilege of being treated by clan trueborn as equals.

For the next few decades Jelly Roll could be found deploying with Ghost Bear forces in a myriad of campaigns under taken by the clan, all the while getting the clan addicted to his tacos.

Most who have deployed with Jelly Roll call his demeanor refreshing and happy, not the grizzled, war-weary personality that most mechwarriors seem to take on. With his legendary cooking talents and sphere-wide famous tacos, adding Jelly Roll to a company is an almost sure-fire way boost the morale and spirits of nearly any company.

content.original:
The daughter of Trex "Kamea" Arano, Julimarie Arano grew up in the waning years of the Coalition's efforts to rebuild the Aurigan Reach following its brutal civil war. As the nation reached its near-golden age, Trex began to slowly integrate Julimarie into the everyday running of the nation.

In this way, Julimarie was groomed from a relatively young age to be a successor to her mother. As Trex reached her senior years, she passed the reigns of leadership to her daughter, now a very experienced figure in her own right and in her prime.

Unfortunately for Juli, her reign would quickly turn from a golden age into one of conflict and devastation as a new cycle of war rippled through the Inner Sphere and Periphery. Before her reign was more than three years old, the Taurian Concordat swiftly and brutally invaded the Reach. With the aid of elite mercenary units, the Coalition forces were routed time and time again, and in short order Julimarie was forced into hiding with what remained of the nation's military.

For the next 4 years, Julimarie worked in secret, evading Taurian patrols and preparing for a guerrilla-style campaign to reclaim her beloved nation. Eventually, having gathered her strength, Julimarie launched herself into the fray into a quest to reclaim her nation, just like her grandmother before her. 

Taking the Taurians by relative surprise, Julimarie was able to rapidly re-secure most of the worlds of the Coalition in fairly short order, capturing huge amounts of Taurian war materiel in the process. Seeking to punish the Taurians for their betrayal, Julimarie ordered the annexation of several Taurian worlds before the Taurians sued for peace.

The next several years were relatively peaceful for the fragile nation, but Julimarie continued her military build-up, determined to break the cycle of war that had repeatedly torn her nation apart. When given the chance to join the so-called new 'Star League', Julimarie jumped at the chance and allied herself to ComStar and the recently arrived Clan Coyote. Launching an assault on the Federated Suns, the Aurigans were met with great success and eventually doubled their size by absorbing some key Davion worlds before the flames of war were slowly put out across the Sphere.

For the rest of her reign, peace was maintained and the nation prospered in ways a Periphery nation could rarely dream of, thanks to the advanced technologies they were able to access from their allies. However, the military might of the nation was drained, with little chance of a quick re-build as neither ComStar nor the Coyotes would provide advanced military hardware.

Towards the end of her reign, the friction of dealing with the alien culture of Clan society began to rise ever-higher and Julimarie began to wonder if allowing the Coyotes into the Rimward-Periphery was a mistake or not. Leaving the throne to her daughter, Julimarie watched the so-called 'Star League' alliance collapse in her final years, just like all previous leagues. On her deathbed she predicted that conflict with the Coyotes would come as the previous allies found themselves, increasingly, on different sides of the rising tensions in the Sphere. Julimarie however took comfort in knowing her daughter would guide the coalition through the coming storm.

content.original:
Born on the world of Lone Star, Glyndwr "Liquidforce" Gunvald, grew up dreaming of the knights of ancient Terra and their battles. Born to a family with long held military traditions, Glyndwr's mother served as a mechwarrior within the elite royal divisions of the SLDF and his father a well respected mechtech in the standard SLDF corps.  

With an upbringing like this, it is little wonder that Glyndwr eventually came to see Mechwarriors as the modern incarnation of the knights of legend and aspired to become one of them. To further this goal, Glyndwr studied hard, eventually applying to and being accepted to the War Academy of Mars. Glyndwr graduated several years later, ranking amongst the top of his class and immediately accepted a role with the 218th Royal Light Horse Regiment.

Being one of the few to survive the destruction of the unit during the periphery uprising Glyndwr was assigned to independent operations within the occupied Terran Hegemony. Smuggled onto worlds with the goal of helping organize local Hegemony garrison survivors, Glyndwr was assigned the new callsign "Liquidforce" to help keep his identity a secret from Amaris soldiers.

By the end of the war, he had served in campaigns to liberate or organize uprisings on 28 different Hegemony worlds, participating in the battle for Unity city itself on Terra.

While most of the SLDF eventually left with General Kerensky, Glyndwr opted to stay behind, having become more determined than ever to see the Hegemony restored to its former glory. Now serving under Lauren Hayes, Glyndwr would become one of the founding members of the Comguard, helping organize and execute operation Silver Shield.

Throughout the first succession war, the Comguard took advantage of Glyndwr's experience to carry out many small, but meaningful operations that required the skills he had obtained over the course of the Amaris crisis. This led Glyndwr all over known space, sometimes operating as a mercenary or infiltrating the military command of various states, all with the goal of furthering ComStar's strategic interests.

Towards the end of his active career, the now aging Glyndwr assumed the role of training the next generation of Comguard operatives and it would be his students that would eventually go on to carry out much of operation Holy Shroud.

While it has never been confirmed, some documents unearthed centuries later by Chandrasekhar Kurita suggest that Glyndwr may have also been a founding member of what would eventually become the Word of Blake.

content.original:
A cunning and ruthless dictator, Majorian was the first non-O'Reilly to ever reign over the Marian Hegemony. Majorian's rise to power differed little from that of the O'Reilly family, rising from a high ranking position and launching a coup d'etat. Once in power Majorian killed or exiled the bulk of the O'Reilly family to prevent them from reclaiming the throne.

Drunk on power, Majorian began a policy of expansion into the faltering Free Worlds League, often deriding the once great successor state as little more than "free real estate". Majorian's cruelty did not go unnoticed and eventually brought them into open war with clan Wolf.

The war with Wolf went poorly and in order to make peace, Majorian was forced to abdecate his throne and become a bondsman to the clan.

Majorian's bondsmanship lasted several years, before he was able to free himself. With the clan distracted by other issues, Majorian quietly slipped back into the hegemony and quickly rebuilt support, forcing Hans O'Reilly out and to flee to the Circinus Federation.

Majorian quickly renewed his war mongering, launching a conquest of the neighbouring Magistracy of Canopus. Catching the Magistracy largely unprepared, the Hegemony ultimately conquered much of Canopus, despite support from numerous allies bolstering the MAF.

Majorian's rule went unimpeded for several years, until the attempted return of Hans O'Reilly with forces of the Circinus Federation launching surprise operation to put O'Reilly back on throne. Unfortunately for the pirates, the Marian's forces seemed to have had some warning of the invasion and were well prepared, repelling the pirates and pushing them back in a counter invasion. Ultimately this cost the federation large portions of its Illriyan and Lothorian conquests.

Aftersn forcing the pirates to terms of peace in favour of the Marians, Majorian would reach his crowning achievement, when an infuriated High-Khan Fiona Kerensky of Clan Wolf delivered a batchall via a large Marble slab dropped from orbit onto the emperor's palace. It is said that the slab very nearly killed the malevolent ruler when it destroyed his favourite bathroom, which he had been in just minutes before.

Majorian accepted the High-Khans batchall and prepped himself for personal combat with the Khan and her second. While Majorian himself was a rather average mechwarrior, unfortunately for the Khan, Somaru, Majorian's second was one of the most skill mechwarriors to have ever been born. Somaru proceeded to decisively win the batchall. From here on out, few would challenge the now power drunk emperor. 

While elements of the MAF would eventually reclaim large portions of the the former Canopean territory, Majorian's Marian Hegemony remained cemented powers of the rimward Inner Sphere for many years to come.

Unfortunately for the emperor himself, Majorians reign was cut short. After ruling the Hegemony for a grand total of 58 years, Majorian found himself slain by his second, as Somura seized power for himself, just after Majorian had finished teaching him everything he knew.
content.prevOriginal:
A cunning and ruthless dictator, Majorian was the first non-O'Reilly to ever reign over the Marian Hegemony. Majorian's rise to power differed little from that of the O'Reilly family, rising from a high ranking position and launching a coup d'etat. Once in power Majorian killed or exiled the bulk of the O'Reilly family to prevent them from reclaiming the throne.

Drunk on power, Majorian began a policy of expansion into the faltering Free Worlds League, often deriding the once great successor state as little more than "free real estate". Majorian's cruelty did not go unnoticed and eventually brought them into open war with clan Wolf.

The war with Wolf went poorly and in order to make peace, Majorian was forced to abdecate his throne and become a bondsman to the clan.

content.original:
Primus Heya 'McDookie' Kerensky Vickers, was one of Comstar's most well-known Primus'. Born to one of the few remaining members of the Kerensky family on Terra, McDookie grew up hearing stories of the Star League and his distant relative and became inspired to create a new star league. Rising through the ranks of Comstar faster than most, McDookie eventually found himself appointed to the position of Primus, and was the youngest ever to be appointed to the role.

Using his charisma and charm, McDookie embarked on a campaign to re-unify the fractured inner sphere in what he called the 3rd Star League (despite there never having been a 2nd). By all accounts, he would have succeeded if the conference on St. Ives to sign the accords had not been attacked by an unknown force. While McDookie survived this attempt on his life, he was gravely wounded and was unable to lead Comstar again for some time. By the time of his return, McDookie found Comstar's power and prestige greatly diminished, though he once again worked to rebuild it.

content.original:
Kommodore Gerheardt Forsythe, better known by his callsign of MiG, once served as the head of the LCAF. Unlike most Lyran officers before or since, MiG was not a social general and rose through the ranks of the LCAF by sheer ability, giving him an edge over most of his opponents who judged him to be like any other Steiner officer. A natural tactician, MiG eschewed many long-held Lyran military tactics, so much so that LCAF records record an attempted court-martial after MiG told another general that assault mechs are not always the answer.

MiG became a household name and hero within the Commonwealth for his role in defending Goat Path and saving the much beloved supply of fresh goat milk from vicious pirate activity. Believed to have been killed in action, just days before his scheduled retirement, MiG was last seen bravely fighting against a massive Valkyrate invasion.

content.original:
Quizel Narf has been described as either one of the greatest or one of the worst pirate lords to have ever graced the history books.

Born on a back water world of the Circinus Federation, Narf grew up hearing stories of daring raids, fortunes won and lost and buried treasure. Enthralled by these tales, even if most weren't true, Narf quickly decided the pirates life was for him and at the young age of 17 joined his first pirate crew.

There Narf stood above his peers, proving to be both cunning, fearless and a natural at finding hidden "booty". These qualities soon found Narf rising through the ranks of command until at the age of 26, when the entire crew he was serving under was wiped out in a Lyran sting operation. 

Barely escaping himself, Narf decided to start his own crew instead of joining someone elses. It was here that Narf's true talent was discovered: his ability to recruit people to his cause. Such was his talent that before his 30th birthday, Narf found himself a pirate lord, having recruited enough people to create and run no less than a dozen different crews all under his command.

Despite his disdain for politics, Narf's power meant he was a household name within the loosely governed federation and he soon found himself a central figure of it. It is here that the federation's craze with racoons is said to have come from as Narf was so fond of the terran raccoon that he underwent numerous surgeries in the nearby Magistracy of Canopus until he outwardly looked like one.

Upon learning of the clan invasion of the Inner-Sphere, Narf fantasized of leading the federation to become a clan, less out of a desire to be recognized as a member of a warrior-people and more because he thought it would be funny and annoy other clans to no end. A mere 5 years later, taking full advantage of the Word of Blake's jihad, Narf and his crews manged to pull off one of the greatest feats any pirate ever has, not only landing on, but sacking Strana Mechty itself. While clan reinforcements forced the pirates off world within hours and years later altered their histories to state the sacking never happened, it did not stop Narf from proclaiming himself khan of a new clan known as "Skull-Squid". While no clan would ever recognize the claim (in fact, some they actively attempted to kill the now infamous pirate lord) it did not stop Narf or his crews from using the term whenever possible.

That is not to say all of Narf's plans went off without a hitch, and one of his greatest failures came with his alliance to Hans O'Reilly and his attempt to help place him on the throne of the Marian Hegemony. When the Circinus invasion badly backfired, Narf's legendary status within the federation was dimmed for several years.

Narf's final fate is not clear. What is known is that the Republic of the Sphere attacked and tried to murder him during his own wedding, successfully assassinating his bride to be. Reports of the time are hazy and it is not clear one way or another to answer if Narf himself was killed. For years after the incident, sightings of the famous Racoon-Pirate continued to take place and the federation itself grew fat off the pirate activity as it preyed on the helpless Free-Worlds-League. However none of these sightings could ever be confirmed, nor could the enrichment of the federation be directly tied to Narf.

In the end however, perhaps it doesn't matter if Narf died that day or lived to plunder for years more, his stories were already out there, inspiring new generations of pirates with his exploits both real and made up. And after we are gone, our stories are what remain.

content.original:
Pagan Horde, was one of the most celebrated khans of clan Burrock. Presiding over a golden age of the clan, Pagan greatly expanded the the power and prestige of the normally small clan. A subscriber to the so-called 'Way of the Murderpede' (whatever that is).

 Pagan eventually became ilkhan of all the clans and one of only two burrock khans to do so, after battle simulations of an invasion of the Inner Sphere showed burrock claiming a vast empire made of of much of the Capellan Confederation, the Terran Hegemoney and portions of the Federated Suns.

content.original:
While most well-known names within Clan society are those of great warriors, there are a select few whose names shine amongst these stars that are not. One such name is that of Rime Lynn, the first IlChi of Clan Stone Lion.

Born into Clan Hell's Horses as a freeborn, Rime's station all but ensured he would never receive the training or resources to become one of the Clan's great warriors. While talented enough to earn himself a spot within the Clan's touman as a tanker, he was never destined to journey with the Clan's trueborn warriors on their conquest of the Inner Sphere.

Fortunately for Rime, this meant he was spared from Clan Hell's Horses' exile from their homeworlds following the War of Reaving. With the Horses now abjured, Rime was part of the homeworld remnants of the Clan that was re-organized into the newly formed Clan Stone Lion.

While most derided the new Clan as a pawn of the Star Adders, Rime was determined to change this notion. With his Clan in desperate need of warriors, Rime found himself pressed into front line forces. Able to hold his own, he made a name for himself with his ability to bring his Clan together, and soon found himself being looked up to by several trueborn warriors after helping them deal with the loss of their former Clan identity.

In June 3080, Rime had a chance encounter with the soon-to-be khan of Clan Coyote, Han Hill during a Trial. During that Trial he left an impression on Hill, sparking renewed communication between the two Clans. Little did Rime know at the time just how impactful this encounter would be on his future.

As communication between the two Clans continued, Rime found himself pressed more and more into the role of chief liaison with Clan Coyote, a position in which he excelled. As relations between the two Clans improved, the overall perception of Clan Stone Lion improved with them. In recognition of Rime's work, and hoping to further improve the standing of the Clan, the Stone Lion Khan made the decision to revive the long forsaken role of "IlChi" and award the position to Rime.

Despite some complaints from the trueborn warriors, most recognized Rime was perfect for the role and, perhaps unsurprisingly, he excelled at it.

Over the course of the next several years, Rime succeeded in re-making the image of Clan Stone Lion, bringing the Clan close with the other Clans in the Kerensky Cluster, with the sole exception of Clan Blood Spirit. Under Rime's tutelage several other Clans revived the office of the IlChi and he became a name known to nearly all the Clan warrior castes.

By the time of his death, Rime Lynn was widely credited for making Clan Stone Lion an accepted part of Clan society, which greatly assisted his Khan's military victories and efforts to expand his Clan's influence in the Kerensky Cluster. His peerless work truly showed even the most stubborn trueborn warrior the value of a PR campaign and setting a new standard for cooperation between Clans.

As communication between the two Clans continued, Rime found himself pressed more and more into the role of chief liaison with Clan Coyote, a position in which he excelled. As relations between the two Clans improved, the overall perception of Clan Stone Lion improved with them. In recognition of Rime's work, and hoping to further improve the standing of the Clan, the Stone Lion Khan made the decision to revive the long forsaken role of "IlChi" and award the position to Rime.

Despite some complaints from the trueborn warriors, most recognized Rime was perfect for the role and, perhaps unsurprisingly, he excelled at it.

Over the course of the next several years, Rime succeeded in re-making the image of Clan Stone Lion, bringing the Clan close with the other Clans in the Kerensky Cluster, with the sole exception of Clan Blood Spirit. Under Rime's tutelage several other Clans revived the office of the IlChi and he became a name known to nearly all the Clan warrior castes.

By the time of his death, Rime Lynn was widely credited for making Clan Stone Lion an accepted part of Clan society, which greatly assisted his Khan's military victories and efforts to expand his Clan's influence in the Kerensky Cluster. His peerless work truly showed even the most stubborn trueborn warrior the value of a PR campaign and setting a new standard for cooperation between Clans.

content.original:
Hailing from the deep-periphery, the exact origins of the mercenary known as 'Sierra3' remain unknown, although a slight spanish accent in his speech strongly suggests that he either hails from, or has spent significant time in the distant Nueva Castile.

Appearing as a rough figure, often seen sporting a Stetson-styled hat and a long trench-coat, evoking images of 'Wild West' of the ancient Terran nation of America, with a personality to match. Sierra3 can be summed up as 'all business, no play' when it comes to his work and takes any job he accepts with the utmost seriousness and professionalism.

Favouring lighter mechs, usually equipped with relatively 'low-tech' but reliable and easy to repair parts, Sierra3 is known to track his quarries across the stars at a relentless pace that few can match. However, do not believe that these choices hinder him in any way, as he is known to be an incredible duelist and has a near impeccable record with the MRBC for completing the contracts he takes on.

Given his often grim personality, his somewhat reclusive nature and nomadic work, it is little wonder that Sierra3 has few whom he calls friends. For those who have earned this title though, Sierra3 will go to any lengths to protect and if necessary, avenge.

content.original: Once serving as the Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation, Slippy was eventually driven mad by an Aurigan Coalition seizure of his personal salt mine. After being driven out of the confederation after he attempted to nuke the system of Capella, the now mad ex-chancellor eventually wound up being installed as the Director of the Aurigan Directorate. Between his constant dressing up in costumes of toads, mad ravings about becoming the First Lord of a 3rd Star League and his delusions of having razed terra with Directorate forces, the stark-raving mad Director has also found time to found a so-called news agency. What passes for news from this agency comes in the form of random nonsense and misinformation, however, it seems that perhaps there is some truth behind at least some of these words as Slippy has found himself to be relentlessy hunted by INN 'Fact-Checker' teams with orders to take down the insane Director.

content.original:
Svelte Sobral is something of an oddity amongst the well known mechwarriors within the Inner Sphere. While regarded as a great mechwarrior, this is not what Svelte is known for. Nor is he amongst those infamous for war crimes. Instead, Svelte is known for being cursed.

No one is sure how or why he is cursed, only that bad luck seems to befall all his employers shortly after the end of his contracts with them. Svelte has found himself blamed for the collapse of the Rasalhague Dominion, the Aurigan Directorate, a Free Worlds League-wide HPG blackout and a failed Wolf invasion of the Magistracy of Canopus.

As a member of the so-called "The New Wolverines", many questions have been raised by his employers, including questions of his origin, any allegiances and who or what were the old wolverines if they are the new ones? Svelte however, doesn't seem to ever answer these questions.

Despite his cursed nature, Svelte still finds employers willing to employ his services, hoping to avoid the curse that seems to follow him around.

Even after the collapse and disbanding of TNW, Svelte could be found fighting for one cause for another before ultimately disappearing. What exactly happened to the mighty mechwarrior is not exactly known, some say his curse finally caught up with him proper and even stranger rumors suggest he was disembodied and turned into a sentient fax machine by the mysterious Casparamaris and left at some backwater location of the Golden Corral.

content.original:
Takashi Kurita is one of the more mysterious members of the storied Kurita house. Takashi once served as the coordinator of Draconis Combine, during one of its most troubled times. Takashi's reign was marred by attacks of a resurgent JarnFolk and the combine suffered greatly at the hands of their raids.

Like his other contemporaries, Takashi nearly formed the so-called '3rd Star League', almost assuredly because of the dire need of the Combine. While Takashi was able to escape from the disaster that was meant to be the signing of a new star league accords on St. Ives, the experience shattered the once proud coordinator's psyche.

Upon hearing rumor that the JarnFolk devastating his nation were secretly FWL troops dressed in viking attire, the coordinator flew into rage and immediately boarded on of the last warships left at the Combine's disposal and set course to Atreus. Takashi was believed killed when his warship was intercepted and destroyed while attempting to unleash nuclear bombardment of the FWL capital to avenge their supposed attacks on the DC. As a result Takashi is rarely spoken about within the Combine

content.original:
"Merchant of Death," "Reaper of Detroit," "Traitor" & "just a typical Capellan." These are all titles that have been used to describe the figure known as "Ruin," "Rapture" & "Teatime." Little concrete information is available about this figure. Even the secret records of the Capellan Confederation offer precious few details other than recording that he is a Capellan citizen.

A deeper dive into some unofficial channels seem to indicate that Teatime was a Maskirovka agent once tasked with advising the Chancellor himself. At some point during this assignment, it seems that Teatime went rogue and used his influence to betray several allies of the Confederation.

Revealed as the root of the betrayal, Teatime was forced to flee, taking on several aliases. Over the course of the next several years, Teatime kept busy by plying the trade routes of Capellan and Canopian space under the guise of a weapons merchant. However, it was eventually found that much of his merchandise was stolen from the Magistracy of Canopus’ own stockpiles and those of the neighbouring Andurien state.

Now hunted by three governments and their agents, Teatime fled to the world of Detroit. On Detroit, forces from all three nations converged to capture the man. However, thanks to years of training, Teatime not only eluded his would be capturers, but turned them against one another. As the three forces battled for who would capture the rogue agent, Teatime unleashed a store of chemical weapons on the planet, decimating its population, along with his hunters. 

Following the Detroit massacre, Teatime disappeared for several more years, eventually surfacing once more, this time at the head of a mercenary band under the employ of the Society during their invasion of the Inner Sphere using the subverted MRBC.

Finally Teatime disappeared altogether, with no confirmed sightings since. Mysteriously, the Capellan records of his crimes and most other documents regarding him vanished at roughly the same time. 

Some unconfirmed theories resound that state that teatime did not actually betray the Confederation at all. Instead they hypothesize he remains a Maskirovka agent, playing out a long and subtle operation. What the aim of this operation is varies from one theory to another, but if any are true, then every citizen in the Sphere should fear what one of the most dangerous Maskirovka agents has in store.

content.original:
Born on Terra to an influential family, Ouranos grew up in a privileged environment and luxury almost unheard of since the fall of the Star League. However, unlike most of his peers, Ouranos did not let this fortune go to his head and instead filled him with an urge to improve the lives of those less fortunate than himself.

Enrolled in the best academies that money and prestige could buy, and a natural affinity for technology it is of little surprise that Ouranos became one of the most knowledgeable in the workings of LosTech, surpassing even many vaunted Star League era scientists and researchers in a time when such knowledge was unheard of. With such a pedigree, Ouranos naturally found himself a position in ComStar.

What was surprising, was Ouranos's forsaking of cushy desk jobs and research positions, instead opting to become a member of the ComGuard. Here he put his knowledge to the test, and was seemingly able to master nearly any 'Mech he piloted with ease.

With innumerable battles and covert operations under his belt, Ouranos proved time after time the most capable of the active ComGuard members and found himself deployed to all corners of the Sphere and near-Periphery. 

Driven by his inner-fire to bring civility back to the war-torn Sphere, Ouranos proved the natural choice to replace then Precentor-Martial Lan Leonhart upon his promotion to Primus, a deadly duo that any opponent dreaded to go up against.

While never destined to become Primus himself, Ouranos contributed greatly to ComStar's golden age, helping to develop new technologies and pushing for the expansion of the Explorer Corp.

content.original:
A member of the so-called 'Ghosts of Skye', or more colloquially known as the 'Rangers', little background information is available on the mysterious Tobias Rieper.

From his own public statements, Tobias was born on the world of Skye, as apparently all members of the ghosts are. Orphaned at an early age, Tobias became a ward of the state, having no living relatives after a rare chemical attack on the world during the closing days of the Fourth Succession War. Too young to remember his family, Tobias was adopted by members of the order and trained from a young age in the ways of warfare.

Upon coming to the age of majority, Tobias was enrolled into the LCAF, and by the powers that be, was assigned to the elite 4th Skye Rangers, which according to Tobias all members of the Ghosts serve in for at least some period of time. Here Tobias distinguished himself, eventually even coming to the attention of the FedCom Archon-Prince after saving the Archon-Prince's life from a would-be assassin. Grateful to the young mechwarrior, the Archon gifted Tobias with a unique variant of the time-tested Orion mech, equipped with the very best tech available to the state.

Tobias used this mech to great effect, and although he left the LCAF shortly before the outbreak of the Clan invasion, Tobias would fight along side his old unit and his fellow ghosts during the Clan Invasion and himself participated in Operation Serpent.

Following the end of the Clan-created crisis, Tobias disappeared from the public, but was later known to have been active during the FedCom Civil war and the Blakist Jihad that followed. 

As war once again engulfed the sphere following Comstar's invasion of the nascent Republic of the Sphere, the Ghosts decided to make themselves known again, this time as mercenaries for hire. Although Tobias was chosen to be their public point of contact, he was clear that he was not their leader, rather he had been forced into the role as the result of a lost bet with someone known as 'Byrd'. From here, Tobias could be found on several fronts of the war, aiding the Taurians conquests of the Calderon Protectorate and Aurigan Coalition. After these conquests, the Rangers proceeded to smash Comstar's lines under the direction of house Davion, largely changing the course of that conflict.

After these high profile contracts, Tobias vanished for sometime, but was spotted aiding the society during their so-called 'Society Summer' invasion. Finally, under the direction of the mysterious council that runs the Ghosts, Tobias and several regiments of Rangers were sent coreward on a mission to claim ownership of clan Cloud Cobra. Here it was revealed that Tobias was a descendant of the Riaz family and under clan laws had possible claims to the Riaz bloodname. After winning the right to bloodname, Tobias engaged the khan of the Cobras in a trial of position, a trial he won with relative ease and in so doing became khan of the clan.

While most clanners were not happy with this, they had little choice to obey as Tobias stirred the Cobras into an invasion of the Ghost Bear Dominion. After a protracted Trial of Possession for 59 worlds of the Bears, the Cobras under Tobias emerged victorious with the aid of the ghost regiments now integrated into the clan. From there, under orders, Tobias proceeded to invade his homeworld of Skye, taking the world under command of the council.

Then Tobias was issued one final set of orders, which he executed in the closing days of the war. Taking advantage of their momentum against the republic, Tobias laid siege to and successfully claimed Terra, becoming ilKhan in the process and making Cloud Cobra the ilClan. At the same time, Cobra forces executed a daring attack on the clan homeworld of Strana Mechty, claiming it for themselves.

For the next several decades Tobias ruled over the Cloud Cobras and eventually returned the world of Skye to Lyran control, evidently the council's overall goal for the entire operation. Some fifty years later, at the age of 92 Tobias finally passed away, becoming the oldest living Khan ever, and the only one for the Cobra's to pass away due to old age, having successfully fended off dozens of challenges for the position over that time span.
